column1: Gold Shines as the US Economy Slows`https://finance.yahoo.com/news/gold-shines-us-economy-slows-102254701.html`2024-02-02 10:22:54`With the Federal Reserve (‘the Fed’) having signalled that a cut to the funds rate is unlikely next month
column2: the slight majority of traders now expects a hold on 20 March according to CME FedWatch Tool.Instability in the Middle East and specifically the USA’s response to attacks on its troops in Jordan has moved out of traders’ view temporarily but remains likely to have some effect on sentiment into next week. The critical release affecting gold today
column3: 2 February
column4: is the job report for January. The figure for total nonfarm is expected to decline around 40
column6: 000 while unemployment might edge up to 3.8%. Whatever the result
column7: volatility for gold is likely to increase further around the release at 13.30 GMT.The overall uptrend still seems to be active
column8: with momentum on 1 February having increased and the price pushing clearly above resistance around $2
column9: 050. Whether it holds there in the near future depends mainly on the result of the NFP and traders’ reactions to it. However
column10: on the whole the technical picture has become more positive in recent days.Buyers appeared to overcome selling pressure as shown by the large upward real body on Thursday coming after two fairly long wicks. Meanwhile the price remains above all of the 20
column12: 100 and 200 SMAs. The movement on 1 February could be interpreted as an upward breakout from a symmetrical triangle
column13: signalling further gains
column14: but a strong result from the NFP could easily drive the price back down.The pound sterling has been flat overall against the dollar since December 2023 with relatively low volatility. As widely expected
column15: the Bank of England (‘the BoE’) held its rate on 1 February and hinted that it sees further hikes as unnecessary unless inflation starts rising significantly again. For now
column16: it’s probably still too early to make a very educated guess on how long or even whether the BoE’s rate will be higher than the Fed’s this summer.Overall
column17: the American economy certainly seems to be performing better than the UK’s in terms of GDP and employment. Apart from the NFP
column18: traders are looking ahead eagerly this month to American inflation and British preliminary GDP for last quarter on 15 February. If the latter’s negative
column19: the UK is likely in recession.As for gold above
column20: the NFP is the critical release for cable this week. Here
column21: though
column22: the potential for a decisive movement seems to be less. The current $1.27 is the same area as late November’s high and generally one wouldn’t expect a major forex pair to sustain a directional trend for a long time. The base case around the job report seems to be movement towards the top of the channel around $1.282 or the bottom near $1.262 depending on the result.The opinions in this article are personal to the author. They do not represent the opinions of Exness.This article was originally posted on FX EmpireUSD/JPY Weekly Forecast – The US Dollar Continues to FightAfrican Sovereigns: Morocco Better Placed Than South Africa To Tackle Economic Challenges AheadAUD/USD Forecast – Australian Dollar Continues to ConsolidateUSD/JPY Forecast – US Dollar Continues to Pressure YenUnited Rentals Shares Are Under Heavy AccumulationAUD/USD Weekly Forecast – Australian Dollar Sits Just Above Major SupportRelated Quotes`['GC=F'

column2: but also because they tend to be scarcer than coins minted with copper
column3: nickel

column5: but even ones worth much less than that can turn a tidy profit.See: Lincoln Pennies With Dime Reverse Sides Are So Rare They’ll Fetch Upwards of $100KFind: Pocket an Extra $400 a Month With This Simple HackFinding rare and valuable silver coins outside of dealers and auctions can be a challenge because there aren’t a ton in circulation anymore. The Coinage Act of 1965
column6: signed by President Lyndon Johnson
column7: eliminated 90% silver coins from circulation
column8: according to a blog from ModernCointMart. That law mainly affected U.S. dimes and quarters. Half-dollar coins were still made with 40% silver from 1965 to 1970
column9: but after 1970 no more circulating U.S. coins were made with silver.You can find still find valuable silver coins on the collectibles market
column10: however
column11: and they might be a good investment. If nothing else
column12: adding silver coins can help diversify your portfolio and give you a hedge against inflation and economic volatility. When spot price eventually rises
column13: provided you have a low dollar cost average regarding your silver stack
column14: you can sell for a profit.If you are interested in buying silver coins
column15: here are four basic types as listed by the United States Gold Bureau (USGB).Also: Rare Bicentennial Quarter Has Nearly $20K Value — Plus 7 More Worth Big MoneySponsored: Owe the IRS $10K or more? Schedule a FREE consultation to see if you qualify for tax relief.These are 90% silver coins minted before 1965
column16: as referenced above. “Junk silver
column17: ” as a category
column18: represents coinage from their period which holds “no collectible or numismatic value” — and is therefore “worthless” to collectors
column19: according to the USGB. It should be noted that not all 90% silver from that period can be classified as “junk silver
column20: ” merely common and/or more damaged or circulated examples. However
column21: you might be able to make a profit from them based on their silver content. As the USGB noted
column22: you can buy these coins cheaply and in bulk to build a large collection with relatively pure silver content.The American Silver Eagle began production in 1986 when the U.S. Defense National Stockpile wanted to get rid of its surplus silver
column23: according to the USGB. One advantage of the American Silver Eagle (ASE) is that it can be used as a silver investment. They’re even eligible as an IRA asset.There are three variations of this 0.999 fine silver coin: bullion ASEs
column24: which are the cheapest and mainly used for silver investing; burnished ASEs
column25: which are the rarest; and proof ASEs
column26: which are the most expensive.The USGB calls the silver Britannia “one of the most recognized rare silver coins on the planet.” The UK Royal Mint created these coins in 1997 following the success of their gold Britannia coins. The 1998 to 2012 editions contained 0.958 pure silver
column27: while those from 2013 on contained 0.999 pure silver. Most of the coins bear images of Queen Elizabeth II
column28: though from 2023 onward the coins bear the visage of King Charles III.This is another silver sovereign coin valued by collectors. It contains 0.9999 fine pure silver and is minted yearly by the Royal Canadian Mint. Like the silver Britannia
column29: many of the Silver Maple Leafs (SMLs) feature Queen Elizabeth II. They have since been updated following the death of the queen in 2022
column30: and newer versions — similarly to the Britannias — feature King Charles III.More From GOBankingRatesI'm a Bank Teller: Here Are 10 Mistakes You Are Making With Your Banking5 Used Cars You Shouldn't BuyUse This Checklist To See Whether Your Bank is Costing You a Lot of Money7 Creative Sources of Passive Income to Consider in 2024This article originally appeared on GOBankingRates.com: These Are the 4 Best Silver Coin Types To Buy in Order To Turn a ProfitRelated Quotes`['GC=F'

11 Best Aluminum and Aluminum Mining Stocks To Buy`https://finance.yahoo.com/news/11-best-aluminum-aluminum-mining-185911107.html`2024-02-02 18:59:11`In this piece
column2: we will take a look at the 11 best aluminum and aluminum mining stocks to buy. If you want to skip our introduction of the aluminum market and the coverage of some recent developments
column3: then you can take a look at the 5 Best Aluminum and Aluminum Mining Stocks To Buy. Aluminum is one of the most important raw materials on Earth. The modern day transportation industry is built on the back of the shiny metal as its light weight and high strength make it suitable for applications that require cost efficiency such as aircraft. Making a steel aircraft is likely to scare engineers when they look at engine fuel consumption and other constraints such as take off weight.Since its demand depends on industrial output
column4: aluminum market prices depend on investor perceptions of global economic activity. If they believe that conditions are ripe for growth
column5: then prices will appreciate as aluminum firms scurry to add capacity. On the supply side
column6: the aluminum industry depends on a handful of countries to continue stable production. If for any reason production is halted
column7: then prices jump as well.As part of our coverage of 15 Largest Aluminum Producing Countries In The World
column8: Insider Monkey discovered that as of December 2022
column9: the People's Republic of China was the world's largest aluminum producer. China produced 40 million tons of aluminum in 2022
column10: and the second biggest aluminum producer was the Republic of India whose four million tons placed it at a distant second.Looking at global aluminum demand
column11: our look at the top fifteen largest consumers of aluminum shows that while China was the largest producer
column12: it was South Korea that led the pack as it consumed nearly 43 kilograms of aluminum per person in 2022. Interestingly though
column13: if you check out Aluminum Consumption By Country: Top 15 then you'll find that while China produced the most aluminum
column14: it was Canada that was the world's largest aluminum supplier as Canadian aluminum exports touched $8.31 billion in 2021.Shifting gears
column15: the aluminum industry is made of large and small companies that have to invest substantial capital in mining facilities. Some of the biggest aluminum companies in the world are spread all over China
column16: Japan
column17: and Australia. These include Rio Tinto Group (NYSE:RIO)
column18: the Saudi Arabian Mining Company
column19: and Vedanta Aluminum. This shows that despite the fact that Canada was the world's largest aluminum exporter in 2021
column20: the aluminum companies themselves are not limited to one continent.In terms of dollar value
column21: the global aluminum industry was worth $255 billion as 2022 ended. Analysts believe that from there onward until 2029
column22: the sector will grow at a compounded annual growth rate (CAGR) of 6.1% until 2029 for an estimated worth of $255 billion.Additionally
column23: since it's literally the building block of modern day construction and transportation
column24: aluminum is also one of the oldest post industrial revolution industries. One of the oldest companies in the world is Alcoa Corporation (NYSE:AA) which was set up in 1886. Alcoa sells bauxite and aluminum
column25: and January 2024 has seen the firm post its fourth quarter of 2023 earnings results. The results saw Alcoa meet analyst revenue estimates and beat them for earnings per share by posting $2.6 billion and -$0.56 (analyst estimates had penciled in an 84 cent loss). Consequently
column26: the shares proceeded to appreciate by double digit percentages in the stock market in the days following the earnings release. Alcoa's earnings saw the firm's management share that raw material costs were favorable during the fourth quarter but higher energy costs continued to be a headwind.According to Alcoa's chief financial officer Molly Beerman:Fourth quarter 2023 adjusted EBITDA increased as improved raw material costs and shipment volumes offset energy and price-mix challenges. In addition
column27: favorable production costs
column28: including recognition of the full-year benefit for Section 45X of the Inflation Reduction Act at Warrick and Massena more than offset higher other expenses. Alumina segment EBITDA increased $31 million sequentially
column29: primarily on lower raw material costs and lower production costs in Brazil and Australia. We also saw a substantial benefit from lower raw material costs in the Aluminum segment

column1: RPT-COLUMN-Another US primary aluminium smelter bites the dust: Andy Home`https://finance.yahoo.com/news/rpt-column-another-us-primary-000001222.html`2024-01-29 00:00:01`"(Repeats Friday's column with no changes to the text)By Andy HomeLONDON
column2: Jan 26 (Reuters) - And then there were four.This week's curtailment of the New Madrid smelter in Missouri leaves just four operating primary aluminium producers on U.S. soil.At the turn of the century the country boasted 20 primary smelters
column3: all but one of them operating.The sector has been devastated by a combination of high power prices
column4: the key cost variable for the electrolysis production process
column5: and high Chinese exports.New Madrid was a poster child for the Trump administration's import tariffs. It was bought out of bankruptcy and restarted just months after the 10% duties were imposed in 2018.But tariffs haven't been enough to save it.Neither has the Biden administration's massive spending on rebuilding domestic critical minerals supply chains.Primary aluminium
column6: although core to both national defence and the clean energy transition
column7: has fallen through the policy gaps.Can the sector be saved? And how much does it matter if it can't be?DECLINE AND FALLTrump's tariffs
column8: intended to reverse the long-term decline of the U.S. primary aluminium sector
column9: have had little lasting impact.Efforts to restart the Intalco smelter in Washington ran out of steam last year
column10: Alcoa announcing its permanent closure in March. Century Aluminum
column11: meanwhile
column12: fully idled its Hawesville smelter in Kentucky in July 2022.Century is still producing primary metal at its Sebree and Mt Holly smelters
column13: the latter at reduced capacity.Alcoa is operating the other two plants. Massena in the state of New York is the world's oldest continuously operating aluminium smelter and is running at its 130
column14: 000-metric ton annual capacity.The Warrick plant in Indiana originally had nameplate capacity of 269
column15: 000 tons but since the middle of 2022 has been operating just two production lines.National primary metal production enjoyed a short-term bounce in 2018-2019 thanks to the restart of New Madrid but has declined every year since.Last year's output was 785
column16: 000 metric tons
column17: compared with 740
column18: 000 tons in 2017
column19: the year before import tariffs were enacted.The curtailment of the 263
column20: 000-ton per year New Madrid smelter will inevitably see national run-rates fall to a new historic low.POWER PROBLEMSMagnitude 7 Metals
column21: which operates New Madrid
column22: blamed the curtailment on ""abnormally cold weather""
column23: which has so impaired operations ""they cannot be restored while running"".However
column24: the smelter has been struggling to turn a profit since its 2018 restart.The company's chief executive Charles Reali told Reuters in February 2020 that ""we're seeing red numbers every month.""The problem is partly the age of the plant
column25: which was built in 1971 and had the dubious distinction of producing the worst quality air in the United States in 2019.That underlines the other big problem
column26: which is that New Madrid is powered by high-cost coal.That puts it at an environmental and commercial disadvantage to global competitors
column27: many of which are rapidly going green by tapping into cheaper renewable power
column28: not least in China.CALL FOR ACTIONThere's a broad consensus about what is needed to prevent the U.S. primary aluminium sector sliding into oblivion.""The announced curtailment of this site is a clear call for the need for low-cost clean energy in America's heartland
column29: according to Ben Jealous
column30: executive director of environmental group Sierra Club.The country's aluminium users agree
column31: calling in September 2023 for the Department of Energy (DoE) to ""invest in American-made clean aluminum to retain and create manufacturing jobs
column32: reduce industrial emissions
column33: and grow a vitally important industry"".The open letter to DoE Secretary Jennifer Granholm was signed by Ford Motor Co.
column34: General Motors
column35: Pepsi Co.
column36: Ball Corp.
column37: Rivian
column38: SunPower and eight others ranging from power conductor manufacturers to brewers.While the Inflation Reduction Act (IRA) is aimed at boosting the U.S. renewable energy sector and includes tax credits for producing primary aluminium
column39: there appears to be no over-arching strategy on how to link the two.GOING
column40: GOING...GONE?An action plan providing for the modernisation of aging facilities and a tie-in with renewable energy needs to come sooner rather than later if the remaining U.S. smelters are going to survive.But is it worth the effort?Although one of the arguments for preserving them is the country's already high import dependency
column41: the nature of that dependency is changing.Penal duties on Russian commodity-grade aluminium imposed in February last year have effectively shut the door on what was once a major source of imports in the U.S. market.Repeated rounds of anti-dumping duties on Chinese semi-manufactured products have also dramatically reduced imports from the world's largest producer.De-risking imports to avoid non-friendly countries has benefited the likes of Canada
column42: which has historically been the single largest supplier to the U.S market-place.Not only is Canada explicitly deemed to be part of the U.S. defense industrial supply chain but Rio Tinto's string of smelters over the border are powered by green hydro energy.The company is also continuously upgrading its plants
column43: most recently announcing an expansion of its modern-technology AP60 smelter to offset the phase-out of the older Arvida plant on the same site.If the U.S. needs more primary metal Canada seems well placed to provide it.In terms of domestic production
column44: the decline in primary production is being more than offset by investment in recycling capacity.Secondary aluminium production has grown steadily over the last twenty years and accounted for 78% of all the aluminium produced in the United States in 2021
column45: according to a 2022 report prepared by the Congressional Research Center. (""U.S. Aluminum Manufacturing: Industry Trends and Sustainability"")The pace of investment in recycling and remelt capacity has since accelerated further thanks to the IRA.If the future is green
column46: the U.S. is not going to be short of green aluminium
column47: whether in primary form from Canada or in secondary form from its own rapidly-growing recycling capacity.Barring an emergency intervention from the U.S. government
column48: it's not clear whether the country's aging primary smelters are going to be part of that future.The opinions expressed here are those of the author
column49: a columnist for Reuters.(Editing by Louise Heavens)Related Quotes"`['AA'
column50: 'CENX']`

column141: with the benefit of additional IRA funding at both Warrick and Massena; completing the Alumar smelter restart and realizing savings from the Kwinana curtailment. All of these locations are fully mobilized and working toward achieving the savings targets.As mentioned earlier

column1: 3 Stocks Poised to Bounce Back After a Brutal 2023`https://finance.yahoo.com/news/3-stocks-poised-bounce-back-033000859.html`2024-01-19 03:30:00`While 2023 was a good year overall for the stock market
column2: not every company shared in the gains. The S&P 500 index rose 24% last year
column3: but most of that growth came from a handful of mega-cap technology stocks known as the Magnificent 7
column4: many of which are closely associated with the red-hot field of artificial intelligence (AI).Numerous stocks continued to decline in 2023 and their shareholders only saw red during the year. Reasons for the decline include poor financial results
column5: difficult economic conditions
column6: and geopolitical events outside of management’s control. That said
column7: things are looking better for many of last year’s laggards. As we begin a New Year
column8: expectations for a turnaround are rising. Here are three stocks poised to bounce back after a brutal 2023.Source: Ascannio / Shutterstock.comTaiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing (NYSE:TSM) looks to be back on track after a difficult time in 2023. TSMC
column9: as the company is commonly known
column10: struggled last year with a drop in demand for consumer electronics such as smartphones and laptops. The decreased demand left smartphone and computer makers with excess inventories of the microchips and semiconductors that TSMC makes. As a result
column11: sales suffered and TSM stock fell 27%.InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column12: Stock Advice & Trading TipsBut now
column13: TSM stock is rebounding and up 7% after the company issued strong fourth-quarter financial results that beat Wall Street expectations right across the board. The world’s largest manufacturer of microchips and semiconductors reported Q4 revenue of $625.53 billion New Taiwan dollars ($19.62 billion U.S.)
column14: which topped consensus forecasts of NT$618.31 billion. Profits also beat Wall Street forecasts. Most importantly
column15: TSMC’s CEO C.C. Wei gave an upbeat forecast for the year ahead
column16: saying the company is well-positioned to capture current and future growth opportunities.Source: Daniel J. Macy / Shutterstock.comFew stocks had it as bad in 2023 as aluminum producer Alcoa (NYSE:AA). Shareholders of the Pittsburgh-based company watched in horror as AA stock plunged 46% over the past year and hit its lowest level since the onset of the pandemic in 2020. Alcoa’s earnings and stock have been impacted by weak commodity prices
column17: with benchmark aluminum prices declining 15% throughout 2023. However
column18: those troubles might now be in the company’s rearview mirror.Alcoa just reported better-than-expected Q4 earnings. The company announced an earnings per share (EPS) loss of 56 cents and sales of $2.60 billion. Wall Street had been looking for an EPS loss of 84 cents and revenue of $2.60 billion. A year ago
column19: Alcoa lost 70 cents a share. In its earnings release
column20: Alcoa’s management team said that the company is likely to ship 2.30 million tons of aluminum in 2024
column21: which is in line with analyst estimates.Source: Carlos l Vives / Shutterstock.comThe heyday of the pandemic seems like a distant memory at biopharmaceutical company Moderna (NASDAQ:MRNA). Owing to declining global sales of its COVID-19 vaccine
column22: MRNA stock has fallen apart
column23: dropping 49% in the last 12 months. The company’s share price is down nearly 80% from the peak it reached in September 2021 when its COVID-19 vaccine orders were rising. However
column24: Moderna’s shareholders recently got some good news through an analyst upgrade.Earlier in January
column25: MRNA stock rose 13% on news of a bullish analyst report from investment bank Oppenheimer (NYSE:OPY). The analysts at Oppenheimer upgraded Moderna’s stock to an “outperform” (buy) rating and said that the company could bring as many as five new medications to market by 2026. The investment bank is bullish about Moderna’s drug pipeline which includes an experimental vaccine that protects the elderly from respiratory syncytial virus (RSV).Moderna also has a flu vaccine in development
column26: along with a cancer vaccine
column27: both of which could come to market in the next few years
column28: according to Oppenheimer. In its most recent earnings report
column29: Moderna said that it expects revenue to fall to $4 billion this year before growing again in 2025.On the date of publication
column30: Joel Baglole did not have (either directly or indirectly) any positions in the securities mentioned in this article. The opinions expressed in this article are those of the writer
column31: subject to the InvestorPlace.com Publishing Guidelines.Joel Baglole has been a business journalist for 20 years. He spent five years as a staff reporter at The Wall Street Journal
column32: and has also written for The Washington Post and Toronto Star newspapers
column33: as well as financial websites such as The Motley Fool and Investopedia.The #1 AI Investment Might Be This Company You’ve Never Heard OfMusk’s “Project Omega” May Be Set to Mint New Millionaires. Here’s How to Get In.The post 3 Stocks Poised to Bounce Back After a Brutal 2023 appeared first on InvestorPlace.Related Quotes`['AA'

Why Apple's iconic Super Bowl ad still resonates 4 decades later`https://finance.yahoo.com/news/why-apples-iconic-super-bowl-ad-still-resonates-4-decades-later-151027182.html`2024-02-10 15:10:27`"Once upon a time
column2: believe it or not
column3: no one particularly looked forward to Super Bowl ads.That all changed when Washington faced Los Angeles on Jan. 22
column5: in Tampa
column6: Fla. Those who tuned in to the big game on CBS — and hadn’t fled to the kitchen for snacks — may have been intrigued by something completely different.In between ads for Gillette Foamy Gel and Northwestern Mutual insurance
column7: a dystopian scene appeared on their TV sets: A line of men wearing faded gray apparel marched mindlessly into a theater
column8: where a bespectacled face
column9: “Big Brother
column10: ” addressed them on a massive screen.Extolling the virtues of groupthink
column11: Big Brother celebrated an imminent victory
column12: free from “pests of any contradictory true thoughts.”Then
column13: the camera cut to a striking blond athlete running in slow motion.Wearing a white tank top and red athletic shorts — and played by British discus thrower and actress Anya Rajah (then Anya Major) — she strode into the theater
column14: with guards in close pursuit. She spun and
column15: with a shout
column16: hurled a sledgehammer at Big Brother’s face. As the screen exploded
column17: large text appeared along with a voice narrating
column18: “On January 24th
column19: Apple Computer will introduce Macintosh. And you’ll see why 1984 won’t be like '1984.'”Happy 40th to one of the greatest ads
column20: Super Bowl or otherwise
column21: of all time.Created by the ad agency Chiat/Day and Apple (AAPL)
column22: “1984” elevated Super Bowl ads to a whole new level. Today
column23: tech historians
column24: ad pros
column25: and techies alike all look back at the commercial not only as a seminal moment in the democratization of personal computing and Super Bowl advertisements
column26: but as a work of art containing themes that still resonate today.Though Rob Schwartz
column27: an advertising industry leader who ran Chiat/Day from January 2015 to April 2021
column28: was not at the agency when the ad was created
column29: he still still remembers feeling inspired by it when it aired. “It marked the first time that the commercials in the Super Bowl were going to be something else to watch besides the game itself. This marked the moment
column30: ” he told Yahoo Finance recently.“It was
column31: ” he added
column32: “the first time where the audience went
column33: ‘Wait
column34: wait
column35: wait
column36: don't go to the bathroom. Let's stay and watch a few commercials before the game comes back.'""But Apple
column37: the Super Bowl aside
column38: was in need of a boost.IBM = Big Brother?In the early 1980s
column39: the company had established itself as a promising tech business with products like the Apple II. In an attempt to make personal computers more accessible
column40: it had then developed the Lisa
column41: named after Steve Jobs’ daughter. Though innovative
column42: the computer had sold poorly
column43: especially compared to IBM’s (IBM) PC
column44: which was released in 1981. Meanwhile
column45: Apple had begun working on the Macintosh
column46: which was meant to accelerate the adoption of the personal computer by the masses.“Apple came into 1984 being walloped by IBM in the personal computing market
column47: and needing a new big hit … the company had bet it all on the Macintosh
column48: spending huge on its R&D
column49: building a new state-of-the-art factory for it
column50: ” said Margaret O'Mara
column51: the Scott and Dorothy Bullitt chair of American History at the University of Washington.But then arose the question of how to advertise the revolutionary new product. Steve Hayden
column52: now 76
column53: then a copywriter at Chiat/Day
column54: still remembers receiving the assignment from Steve Jobs directly. The young tech visionary reportedly wanted to “stop the world in its tracks” and entrusted the L.A.-based firm with the job.Along with art director Brent Thomas
column55: Hayden began brainstorming. He rifled through old ad concepts he had worked on in San Francisco and found one with the headline ""Why 1984 won't be like '1984
column56: '"" a line Hayden attributed to fellow Chiat/Day copywriter Gary Gussick. At first
column57: Hayden and Thomas toyed with a comical conception of 1984 “like the Jetsons.” But the ad’s director
column58: a well-known talent by the name of Ridley Scott
column59: had a better idea.“He came and looked at our initial board … he brought in this wonderful coffee table book about the making of Metropolis
column60: the movie
column61: and the dramatic huge machines and the interface between humans and these kinds of overwhelming technologies
column62: ” Hayden explained. “And so the art direction took a really sharp turn at that point to meet that vision.”The advertising experts had already come up with the Big Brother character and Scott insisted that they introduce another
column63: a heroine who would contrast starkly with the all-male cast and ""break the spell
column64: Hayden said.A new ageThe heroine symbolized more than simple rebellion against Big Brother. As historian O’Mara pointed out
column65: the ad aired during the height of the Cold War and year of the 1984 Summer Olympics in Los Angeles. “I think it's telling that she's dressed as a track athlete and dressed as if she's running for the United States
column66: she said.The heroine also represented the Macintosh. While computers had previously been monopolized by experts — think mainframes and IBM — the Macintosh offered a revolutionary user interface that made personal computers accessible to the mass market.“She was supposed to represent freedom and the dawning of a new age
column67: and therefore
column68: Macintosh
column69: ” Hayden said.Added Chiat/Day’s Schwartz: “You have to remember that this was a time when computers were only used for business … When she throws that sledgehammer
column70: she is all of us … and she represents all of us trying to destroy any kind of tyranny or dictatorship
column71: even if it's just a dictator for a day
column72: we don't want that. We want to be free. And I think the power of that is the reason why people talk about it
column73: 40 years later.”But there were some naysayers within the company. Apple's board of directors hated it and almost stopped it from airing. Meanwhile
column74: Hayden himself felt unsure about his work. “I had my own concerns that it might be too foreign in structure and content for an American audience
column75: ” he said. “It didn't match the traditional advertising forms.”But Jean-Louis Gassée
column76: now 79
column77: who was then running Apple France
column78: still recalls the first time he saw the ad at a 1983 meeting to prepare for the January launch of the Macintosh. “We had never seen advertising like this ... it was absolutely stunning. And then the lights went up a little bit and from the top of the theater machinery
column79: a Mac came down on a wire
column80: and halfway through the descent it [was amplified by microphones]
column81: ” he told Yahoo Finance. “So we could hear what became the highly recognizable “bong” of the Mac starting. There was this hysteria in the room.”Though Hayden and the rest of his team at Chiat/Day had never specifically intended “Big Brother” to represent IBM
column82: Jobs quickly adopted that framing. After showing the ad
column83: Jobs gave a “fiery” anti-IBM speech
column84: “saying that the Macintosh would change the world
column85: ” according to Gassée. “It was easy at the time to superimpose the Big Brother and the big IBM images.”Holding upIt is actually stunning to watch the ad today and see how it still holds up. Only this time
column86: you can imagine Big Brother appearing on your screen as Tesla’s (TSLA) Elon Musk
column87: Meta’s (META) Mark Zuckerberg
column88: and the developers of ChatGPT and other artificial intelligence products.At least Jean-Louis Gassée sees it that way. He asserted that the ad is still relevant as we grapple with the likes of AI and user privacy in the world of Facebook and X. It serves as “a good way to remind us of the necessary fight between established powers and upstarts.”He added: “I think the ad presents two views of technology. One that is Big Brother-like
column89: oppressive
column90: and one which is the Macintosh
column91: a way to break through the domination of Big Brother technology.” he said. “So this ad in 1983
column93: presented a view of the conflict between usages of technology. I think that that conflict is still alive.”Enjoy the Super Bowl.Dylan Croll is a Yahoo Finance reporter.Related Quotes"`['TSLA'
column94: 'IBM'
column95: 'META'
column96: 'AAPL']`

column1: Insulet's (PODD) Omnipod 5 Gets CE Mark for Added Compatibility`https://finance.yahoo.com/news/insulets-podd-omnipod-5-gets-145200403.html`2024-02-08 14:52:00`Insulet Corporation PODD recently received CE mark approval under the European Medical Device Regulation for the added compatibility of the Abbott Laboratories’ ABT FreeStyle Libre 2 Plus sensor with its Omnipod 5 Automated Insulin Delivery System. It is applicable for individuals aged two years and above with type 1 diabetes.The Omnipod 5 System consists of the tubeless Pod enhanced with SmartAdjust Technology and the Omnipod 5 Controller with its integrated Smartbolus Calculator.Insulet expects Omnipod 5 integration with the Abbott FreeStyle Libre 2 Plus sensor to be available first in the U.K. and Netherlands in a phased launch in the first half of 2024. Additional markets are expected to follow.With the latest regulatory approval
column2: Insulet is expected to solidify its foothold in the global continuous glucose monitoring (CGM) business.Per Insulet
column3: Omnipod 5 is currently the first and only tubeless hybrid closed loop system (also known as automated insulin delivery) that is approved for CE marking and integrated with two CGM sensor brands
column4: Abbott’s FreeStyle Libre and Dexcom.Insulet’s management believes that the addition of the Abbott FreeStyle Libre 2 Plus sensor to its CGM compatibility will likely expand the accessibility of Omnipod 5 and serve more people who have diabetes.Per a report by Grand View Research
column5: the global CGM device market size was valued at $4.60 billion in 2023 and is expected to reach $7.51 billion by 2030 at a CAGR of approximately 7.2%. Factors like the rising cases of diabetes and the increasing adoption of CGM devices are likely to drive the market.Given the market potential
column6: the latest regulatory approval is expected to provide a significant boost to Insulet’s business globally.In November 2023
column7: Insulet reported its third-quarter 2023 results
column8: wherein it registered a robust uptick in its top and bottom lines. The company’s performance benefited as a result of the continued high demand for Omnipod 5 both in the United States and globally. The company commercially launched Omnipod 5 in Germany — the second European Omnipod 5 launch — with the intent to launch Omnipod 5 more broadly across Europe starting in 2024.In October
column9: Insulet received the FDA’s 510(k) clearance for the Omnipod 5 App for iPhone.Shares of Insulet have lost 30.6% in the past year against the industry’s 6.2% rise and the S&P 500's 22.9% growth.Image Source: Zacks Investment ResearchCurrently
column10: Insulet carries a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold).A couple of better-ranked stocks in the broader medical space are DaVita Inc. DVA and Merit Medical Systems
column11: Inc. MMSI.DaVita
column12: carrying a Zacks Rank #2 (Buy)
column13: has an estimated long-term growth rate of 17.3%. DVA’s earnings surpassed estimates in each of the trailing four quarters
column14: with the average surprise being 36.6%. You can see the complete list of today’s Zacks #1 Rank (Strong Buy) stocks here.DaVita’s shares have gained 34.9% compared with the industry’s 7.4% rise in the past year.Merit Medical
column15: carrying a Zacks Rank of 2 at present
column16: has an estimated long-term growth rate of 11.5%. MMSI’s earnings surpassed estimates in each of the trailing four quarters
column17: with the average being 14.4%.Merit Medical has gained 10.6% compared with the industry’s 12.4% rise in the past year.Want the latest recommendations from Zacks Investment Research? Today

column1: New Study Shows Mixed Reality Technology for Blood Donation From Abbott and Blood Centers of America Helps Ease Stress
column2: Encourages People To Donate Again`https://finance.yahoo.com/news/study-shows-mixed-reality-technology-133000059.html`2024-02-08 13:30:00`"Mixed reality experience allows blood donors to visit a digital world while remaining fully aware of their surroundings for a safe
column3: relaxing donation68.4% of pilot study participants who reported pre-donation anxiety said the mixed reality experience helped ease feelings of anxiety89.2% of donors who tried mixed reality said they were likely to donate blood againInnovation is designed to attract new donors and motivate a younger generation to give bloodABBOTT PARK
column4: IL / ACCESSWIRE / February 8
column5: 2024 / AbbottA new study published online and available in the February print edition of the journal Transfusion shows the mixed reality technology for use during blood donation created by Abbott (NYSE:ABT) and Blood Centers of America (BCA) helps ease donors' feelings of anxiety and boosts the likelihood they will return to give blood again.Results from the pilot study reveal that mixed reality ""is an innovative technology that holds promise to increase donor engagement
column6: satisfaction
column7: and retention
column8: researchers said.Abbott
column9: the global leader in screening blood and plasma
column10: partnered with Blood Centers of America
column11: the largest blood supplier network in the U.S.
column12: to launch a mixed reality experience for blood donors in June 2023. It is now available at several donation sites across the country
column13: including in New York
column14: Houston and the Chicago area. More blood donation sites will offer the experience soon.The Abbott and BCA mixed reality innovation is an immersive digital experience designed to improve the blood donation process
column15: attract new donors and motivate a younger generation to give blood. Donors wear lightweight mixed reality headsets to visit a digital world while remaining fully aware of their real-world surroundings. The effort aims to address the global challenge of sustaining a reliable blood supply.The pilot study examined the experiences of 282 blood donors who tried mixed reality at 54 collection sites in Houston and the Quad Cities area in Iowa and Illinois.Of the 142 donors who reported pre-donation anxiety
column16: 68.4% said the use of mixed reality during donation decreased their reported anxiety. The top reported causes of pre-donation anxiety were fear that donation would hurt
column17: fear of feeling badly after donating
column18: fear of needles
column19: fear of fainting and fear of the unknown.For donors who tried mixed reality while donating
column20: 89.2% said they wanted to come back to donate again.""We found that using mixed reality while donating blood helps many donors relax and decreases stress
column21: said Theodore Kieffer
column22: MD
column23: U.S. area medical director for Abbott's transfusion business and a co-author of the study. ""It's encouraging to see this innovation improve the blood donation experience and potentially inspire a younger generation to become donors.""The mixed reality experience allows blood donation professionals to safely conduct the donation and interact with donors at every step of the process. Because the mixed reality glasses are transparent
column24: donors' eyes are always visible during donation to ensure constant monitoring and evaluation.The mixed reality experience was designed based on research that natural settings are the most preferred environment as donors give blood. Participants visit a whimsical virtual garden while listening to soothing music
column25: moving a cursor with their eye movement and planting seeds that grow into colorful trees and flowers.The innovation was designed to help boost the sustainability of the nation's blood supply and attract younger people since blood centers have lost about 30% of donors under the age of 30 over the last decade. On average
column26: only 3% of the eligible U.S. population donates blood each year.In the pilot study
column27: 54% of donors with baseline reported anxiety said they would use mixed reality again
column28: with the highest future interest in young donors.""The adoption of mixed reality in blood donation is a significant innovation
column29: particularly for attracting new donors. By making the donation process more engaging and less intimidating
column30: this innovation can play a crucial role in increasing the blood supply
column31: said Jennifer Kapral
column32: senior vice president at Blood Centers of America and a co-author of the study. ""Mixed reality helps modernize the donation experience and also potentially increases the frequency and number of younger donors. It can really make a difference to get more people interested in donating and making it more fun when they do.""Mixed reality is part of Abbott and BCA's broader
column33: ongoing effort to energize younger people to donate blood
column34: motivate first-time donors and cultivate a new generation to help sustain the nation's blood supply. In 2023
column35: the combination of those efforts helped increase donations 11% among 16-24 year olds.The pilot study was conducted at sites operated by Impact Life of Davenport
column36: Iowa
column37: and Gulf Coast Regional Blood Center in Houston during February and March 2023. Researchers affiliated with Stanford University and Stanford Blood Center
column38: Johns Hopkins University and the Southern Illinois University School of Medicine
column39: Abbott
column40: Blood Centers of America
column41: Impact Life and Gulf Coast Regional Blood Center conducted and authored the study.To find out more about donation locations offering mixed reality visit bethe1donor.com/mixedreality.About Abbott:Abbott is a global healthcare leader that helps people live more fully at all stages of life. Our portfolio of life-changing technologies spans the spectrum of healthcare
column42: with leading businesses and products in diagnostics
column43: medical devices
column44: nutritionals and branded generic medicines. Our 114
column45: 000 colleagues serve people in more than 160 countries.Connect with us at www.abbott.com and on LinkedIn
column46: Facebook
column47: Instagram
column48: X and Youtube.For further information: Abbott Media
column49: Patrick O'Connell
column50: 847-282-2649; Investor Relations
column51: Ryan Aliff

column2: we will take a look into Abbott Laboratories's (NYSE:ABT) DCF analysis

column8: while in the terminal stage

column12: prioritizing the average EPS without NRI growth rate from the past 10
column14: or 3 years in that order

column16: the eps will grow at 4% for 10 years. It is important to ensure that the terminal growth rate remains lower than the discount rate to facilitate convergence in the calculation.Growth Stage=EPS without NRI*[ (1 + g1) / (1 + d)*(1 + g1) ^ 2 / (1 + d) ^ 2+...+(1 + g1) ^ 10 / (1 + d) ^ 10 ]=53.74Terminal Stage=EPS without NRI*(1 + g1) ^ 10 / (1 + d) ^ 10*[ (1 + g2) / (1 + d)+(1 + g2) ^ 2 / (1 + d) ^ 2+...+(1 + g2) ^ 10 / (1 + d) ^ 10 ]=46.4Intrinsic Value: DCF (Earnings Based)=Growth Stage+Terminal Stage=100.14GuruFocus also provides the calculation using the traditional approach of free cash flow. column18: accompanied by a margin of safety of -212.41%. You can always switch to using Free Cash Flow per Share to calculate the real DCF model on our DCF calculator page.Please note that while the DCF model is a robust valuation methodology

column1: Adicet Provides Corporate Update and Highlights Strategic Priorities for 2024`https://finance.yahoo.com/news/adicet-provides-corporate-highlights-strategic-120000882.html`2024-01-04 12:00:00`"Expanding clinical development of ADI-001 into autoimmune diseases following clearance of Investigational New Drug Application (IND); plan to initiate Phase 1 clinical study in 2Q 2024Focusing enrollment on mantle cell lymphoma (MCL) in ongoing ADI-001 Phase 1 clinical trial given favorable complete response (CR) rate
column2: durability
column3: and safetyADI-001 clinical update expected 2H 2024ADI-270 IND submission in renal cell carcinoma expected in 2Q 2024Updated cash runway into 2H 2025REDWOOD CITY
column4: Calif. & BOSTON
column5: January 04
column6: 2024--(BUSINESS WIRE)--Adicet Bio
column7: Inc. (Nasdaq: ACET)
column8: a clinical stage biotechnology company discovering and developing allogeneic gamma delta T cell therapies for cancer and autoimmune diseases
column9: today provided corporate updates and highlighted upcoming priorities for its pipeline programs in 2024.""In 2024
column10: we aim to make significant strides across our pipeline of differentiated gamma delta T cell therapies through our strategic and disciplined approach
column11: said Chen Schor
column12: President and Chief Executive Officer at Adicet Bio. ""The U.S. FDA’s IND clearance of ADI-001 in lupus nephritis marks an important milestone in maximizing the ADI-001 opportunity in the autoimmune therapeutic category that we believe it is ideally suited to address. Clinical data for ADI-001 have demonstrated B-cell depletion that mirrors the B cell depletion by autologous alpha-beta CAR T in academic clinical studies in systemic lupus erythematosus
column13: systemic sclerosis
column14: and idiopathic inflammatory myopathy patients. Given that gamma delta 1 T cells preferentially traffic to organs and tissues
column15: ADI-001 is designed to target and deplete B cells in the periphery
column16: secondary lymphoid organs
column17: kidneys
column18: and other organs
column19: which is highly desirable in autoimmune diseases. ADI-001’s off-the-shelf availability and the favorable safety profile provide the potential for outpatient administration.""Mr. Schor continued: ""Our internal research and development efforts are focused in areas where we believe we have a high probability of success and opportunity for significant differentiation. In our ongoing Phase 1 clinical trial of ADI-001 in relapsed or refractory NHL
column20: we have decided to focus our current patient enrollment on the MCL population
column21: which demonstrated the greatest clinical benefit in our June 2023 clinical update. With projected cash runway into the second half of 2025
column22: multiple upcoming milestones
column23: and a disciplined approach
column24: we believe we are well-positioned to advance our pipeline of allogeneic T cell therapy candidates to address substantial unmet needs in oncology and autoimmune diseases.""Program Updates and Expected Milestones for 2024ADI-001 is an investigational allogeneic gamma delta CAR T cell therapy targeting CD20 for the potential treatment of relapsed or refractory B-cell non-Hodgkin’s Lymphoma (NHL) and autoimmune diseases.Autoimmune diseasesIND cleared for lupus nephritis. In December 2023
column25: the FDA cleared Adicet’s IND application for ADI-001 in lupus nephritis.Initiate Phase 1 clinical trial of ADI-001 for the treatment of lupus nephritis in the second quarter of 2024. The Company plans to initiate a Phase 1 clinical trial to assess the safety and efficacy of ADI-001 in lupus nephritis and may provide a clinical update from the trial in the second half of 2024. Adicet expects to expand into additional autoimmune indications in the near future.Hematologic malignanciesFocus enrollment on MCL patients in ongoing Phase 1 GLEAN study. Adicet will focus on the MCL patient population in the ongoing Phase 1 GLEAN study (at dose level 4)
column26: which experienced the greatest clinical benefit in the June 2023 update. While these were early data
column27: an 80% CR rate and 60% 6-month CR rate in late line MCL patients were reported in the June 2023 clinical update
column28: Cmax and exposure by area under the curve (AUC) exceeded that of approved autologous CD19 CAR T therapies
column29: and a favorable safety profile was observed with no significant risk of cytokine release syndrome
column30: immune effector cell associated neurotoxicity syndrome or T-cell malignancies. These initial clinical results
column31: coupled with the potential to dose off-the-shelf in a community setting
column32: support ADI-001 as a potentially attractive therapy for MCL patients. The Company is evaluating the option of advancing ADI-001 to a potentially pivotal study in MCL patients under an accelerated approval pathway.The Company remains on track to provide an ADI-001 clinical update in the second half of 2024.ADI-270 is an investigational allogeneic gamma delta CAR T cell therapy targeting CD70 via the CD27-ligand for the treatment of renal cell carcinoma with potential in other solid tumor indications. ADI-270 is designed to home to solid tumors
column33: with a highly specific targeting moiety for CD70 and an armoring technology of TGF beta dominant- negative receptor to address immunosuppressive factors in the tumor microenvironment. Building on gamma delta 1 tissue tropism to solid tumors and three mechanisms of anti-tumor activity (CAR
column34: innate and adaptive)
column35: CAR gamma delta 1 T cells may be well positioned to address solid tumors.Renal cell carcinomaPlan to file IND for ADI-270 in 2Q 2024. Following positive feedback from a pre-IND meeting with the FDA
column36: the Company remains on track to file an IND application for ADI-270 in the second quarter of 2024.Financial OutlookThe Company expects cash and cash equivalents on hand as of December 31
column38: to enable funding for current and planned operations into the second half of 2025.Webcast/ Conference Call InformationThe live webcast of the presentation can be accessed by registering under ""Presentations & Events"" in the investors section of the Company’s website at https://www.adicetbio.com. Upon registration
column39: all participants will receive a confirmation email with a unique passcode to provide access to the webcast event. To participate via telephone
column40: please join by dialing 888-788-0099 (domestic) or 312-626-6799 (international) and referencing the conference ID 918 2940 8885. An archived replay will be available for 30 days following the presentation. The archived webcast will be available on the Company's website beginning approximately two hours after the event.About Adicet Bio

column1: Leading the Adoption of 5G Spectrum Harmonization can Unlock up to $200B in U.S. Economic Growth
column2: According to New Report`https://finance.yahoo.com/news/leading-adoption-5g-spectrum-harmonization-150000001.html`2024-02-07 15:00:00`"WASHINGTON
column3: Feb. 7
column4: 2024 /PRNewswire/ -- Allocating internationally harmonized mid-band spectrum for 5G can unlock approximately $200B to America's economy over the next 10 years
column5: according to a new study by Accenture (NYSE: ACN) commissioned by CTIA
column6: the wireless industry association. There is a risk of America's wireless industry limiting its ""future leadership of the global wireless ecosystem"" if embracing 5G spectrum allocation is not fully supported. This could also impact adjacent industries that leverage wireless technology such as manufacturing
column7: utilities
column8: and others in the U.S.
column9: the study finds.The report
column10: Advancing U.S. Wireless Excellence: The Case for Global Spectrum Harmonization
column11: finds that spectrum harmonization is key to achieving ""economies of scale across the wireless value chain as well as fueling new sources of growth and innovation."" While most countries are rapidly coalescing around a set of internationally harmonized bands to support their 5G networks and realize these benefits
column12: the U.S. has less spectrum than its international peers
column13: including China
column14: and no plans to free up additional 5G spectrum in the near term.""As we saw at the World Radiocommunication Conference (WRC)
column15: the rest of the world is moving quickly to allocate significant amounts of internationally harmonized mid-band spectrum for 5G to meet exploding demand and build a foundation for future innovation and economic growth
column16: said Meredith Attwell Baker
column17: President and CEO
column18: CTIA. ""To avoid becoming a wireless technology island and secure our economic competitiveness
column19: it is critical that we move quickly to allocate more full power
column20: licensed spectrum for 5G with global bands.""According to the study
column21: the U.S. can secure its wireless leadership and achieve significant economic benefits by leading the adoption of internationally harmonized spectrum bands. Leading spectrum harmonization also benefits American consumers by lowering the cost of wireless products and services
column22: accelerating the development of innovative 5G use cases and supporting the continued growth and development of trusted network infrastructure companies.""Remediating its mid-band spectrum deficit will be imperative for the U.S. to fuel new sources of growth and innovation. Ignoring this opportunity now can jeopardize the wireless leadership it achieved in 4G
column23: and in the early phase of 5G's rollout
column24: said Tejas Rao
column25: managing director
column26: Accenture Cloud First Networks. ""Taking calculated and swift action is necessary to position the U.S. at the forefront of wireless innovation and lay the foundation for future growth.""The U.S. should focus its efforts on freeing up mid-band spectrum for full-power
column27: licensed 5G use that will fuel use cases ranging from 5G home broadband
column28: smart manufacturing
column29: precision agriculture
column30: and more.The two bands that stand out given recent developments at the WRC globally and their inclusion in the National Spectrum Strategy domestically are:The lower 3 GHz band is already harmonized and widely used around the world
column31: making it the ideal spectrum to start catching up with the rest of the world on mid-band 5G allocations.The 7/8 GHz band
column32: which is slated for future mobile use internationally
column33: gives the U.S. a clear opportunity to lead in developing the wireless ecosystem using this next key spectrum band.The study highlights that leading the adoption of key spectrum bands could drive up to $200B in U.S. economic growth over the next ten years. This includes more than $150B from new jobs
column34: leadership in new industries

An additional $44B would come from taking advantage of economies of scale in network equipment and device production.Leading the adoption of internationally harmonized bands will also support the U.S.' goal of securing its network equipment supply chain

column1: Inside the shifting plan at Elon Musk’s X to build a new team and police a platform ‘so toxic it’s almost unrecognizable’`https://finance.yahoo.com/news/inside-shifting-plan-elon-musk-230907908.html`2024-02-06 23:09:07`"In the spring of 2023
column2: when X was still called Twitter
column3: the company began planning a new system to keep the most undesirable content off of its platform.In place of the army of contract workers that policed most social media sites
column4: including Twitter
column5: the company would build its own
column6: smaller
column7: in-house team of content moderators — a specialized safety net to prevent the most egregious stuff from slipping through without crimping too much on Twitter owner Elon Musk's outspoken commitment to ""free speech.""Last week
column8: nearly one year later
column9: X announced a new Trust and Safety Center of Excellence in Austin
column10: Texas. The 100-person team of content moderators touted by an X representative in a Bloomberg news report is significantly smaller than the 500-person team that was initially envisioned
column11: according to a former trust and safety staffer. And it’s unclear if X has hired more than a dozen or so people so far.Still
column12: at a time when lawmakers are turning up the heat on social media companies for endangering children
column13: X's safety center in Austin has clear PR value. The new center will ""bring more agents in house to accelerate our impact
column14: X CEO Linda Yaccarino said at a Senate hearing on Wednesday.While some critics took note of the opportunistic timing of the announcement
column15: the details of X’s Austin plan raise a bigger question about the Musk-owned platform: Could Musk’s unconventional approach to content moderation outperform the social media industry's woeful track record of online safety
column16: or does it represent just another means to cut costs by an organization with little interest in deciding which content is appropriate for its users.According to several content moderation experts and current or former X insiders that Fortune spoke to
column17: a team of in-house specialists could provide significant advantages compared to the current industry norms. But many also stressed the importance of a coherent underlying policy and investments in tools and technology.“X+100 is better than just X
column18: in terms of moderation capacity
column19: ” a source familiar with trust and safety at X explained. But
column20: the person continued
column21: “the number of humans at computers matters less
column22: in some ways
column23: than having clear policies rooted in proven harm reduction strategies
column24: and the tools and systems necessary to implement those policies at scale — both of which have been dismantled since late 2022.”X did not respond to requests for an interview or to comment for this story.The flood of problematic content on X has become a frequent topic of public debate—and disputes— since Musk’s $44 billion acquisition closed in November 2022.After the Center for Countering Digital Hate published a report claiming that X failed to moderate ""extreme hate speech
column25: Musk sued the group for doing calculated harm with ""baseless claims."" Meanwhile videos of graphic animal abuse have spread widely on the platform
column26: according to reports. And just last week explicit
column27: AI-generated content featuring Taylor Swift circulated unchecked for 17 hours until the platform shut down the ability to search for her name at all.X also leans heavily on its Community Notes feature
column28: which allows approved users to add a note to posts with additional context
column29: to moderate its millions of active users
column30: the former trust and safety staffer said. But the person emphasized that this is merely ""one tool"" that should be used for moderation. What's more
column31: a Wired investigation uncovered coordinated efforts within the feature to propagate disinformation
column32: highlighting a lack of significant oversight from the company.By some estimates Musk has cut 80% of the engineers dedicated to trust and safety and thinned the ranks of outsourced content moderators whose job it is to monitor and remove content that violates the company’s policies. In July
column33: Yaccarino announced to staff that three leaders would oversee various aspects of trust and safety
column34: such as law enforcement operations and threat disruptions
column35: Reuters reported. However
column36: according to another source at X
column37: it's unclear where T&S stands within the organization's hierarchy
column38: noting that the group doesn't appear to be ""at the top level anymore.""However
column39: within Musk’s social media company
column40: there also has been an effort to rethink how the job is done.The new Austin center actually began as a Bay Area center. The intention was to establish the center in a city like San Francisco
column41: which would help recruit top-tier multilingual talent—crucial for countering Internet trolls
column42: since more than 80% of X’s user base don’t live in the U.S.
column43: a source familiar with trust and safety under Musk told Fortune. Given the nuances of individual languages
column44: and the idioms and expressions unique to each one
column45: the idea was that someone familiar with a specific language or culture could
column46: for example
column47: better distinguish a joke from a threat than could a low-paid generalist contract worker with no specialized skills.“They actually started this by hiring people in the Bay Area to test their quality level and whether or not it would work better than having it outsourced
column48: ” the former staffer said. “[X] hired a small team of people and tested it out and their ability to make accurate decisions.” The plan called for starting with 75 staffers and to eventually scale it to a 500-person team if it delivered results.However
column49: Musk
column50: at that time
column51: leaned towards a more cost-effective location
column52: favoring Austin
column53: because he was certain in his ability to attract and potentially relocate individuals proficient in various languages. The change has added a few wrinkles to the project.“Having to hire hundreds of people and get them up and running and trained and all that is a roughly two to three month process
column54: ” the former X staffer explained. “Then you start training and so you know
column55: realistically you're looking at three
column56: four or five months before you get a team in place. That assumes the job market is awesome
column57: right? And you don't have to relocate people and all of that fun stuff.”According to LinkedIn
column58: a dozen recruits have joined X as “trust and safety agents” in Austin over the last month — and most appeared to have moved from Accenture
column59: a firm that provides content moderation contractors to Internet companies. It's not clear if X has a contract-to-hire plan in place with Accenture—whereby workers retained by consulting firms like Accenture are given full-time roles at a client company when there’s a good fit—but the source confirmed that X has used Accenture’s contracting services in the past.There are a lot of questions about what exactly the Austin team will focus on. Will they focus on content involving only minors
column60: or only in the U.S.? Will they focus on individual posts
column61: or conduct investigations into sexual exploitation?""100 people in Austin would be one tiny node in what needs to be a global content moderation network
column62: ” former Twitter trust and safety council member Anne Collier told Fortune. “100 people in Austin
column63: I wish them luck”Whatever their task
column64: social media moderation experts agree that the company will need to make a significant investment in AI tools for the team to be most effective.Facebook for example employed about 15
column65: 000 moderators globally in 2020 when it announced it was “marrying AI and human reviewers to make less total mistakes
column66: ” the Verge reported at the time. Snap operates similarly
column67: stating in a blog post that it uses “a combination of automated tools and human review to moderate.”According to the former X insider
column68: the company has experimented with AI moderation. And Musk’s latest push into artificial intelligence technology through X.AI
column69: a one-year old startup that’s developed its own large language model
column70: could provide a valuable resource for the team of human moderators.An AI system “can tell you in about roughly three seconds for each of those tweets
column71: whether they're in policy or out of policy
column72: and by the way
column73: they're at the accuracy levels about 98% whereas with human moderators
column74: no company has better accuracy level than like 65%
column75: ” the source said. “You kind of want to see at the same time in parallel what you can do with AI versus just humans and so I think they're gonna see what that right balance is.”But no matter how good the AI tools and the moderators
column76: the performance is only as good as the policy that drives it
column77: and that’s an area where X has struggled under Musk.Policies need to be flexible enough to adapt to cultural contexts
column78: but they also need to be sufficiently predictable for everyone to understand what the rules are
column79: the source familiar with trust and safety at X explained. This is especially important when moderating content on a large platform ""where hundreds or even thousands of moderators have to understand and interpret a stable set of rules. You can't implement rules consistently and accurately if they're constantly shifting
column80: the person said.The loosening of the rules
column81: and the resulting lack of clarity
column82: has been one constant at X under Musk’s stewardship.After Musk’s takeover
column83: he went on to reinstate a slate of accounts that were banned for breaking the platform’s policies: Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene violated COVID-19 misinformation policies
column84: the Babylon Bee posted a transphobic story that violated Twitter's hateful conduct policy
column85: Andrew Tate (banned from Facebook
column86: Instagram
column87: and TikTok) was banned for saying that women should bear ""some responsibility"" for being sexually assaulted. All these people were reinstated under Musk.Some outlets speculated there was a link between the exit of Ella Irwin—the final head of trust and safety during Musk's tenure—and Musk's criticism of the team's decision to remove Matt Walsh's transphobic ""What is a Woman?"" documentary
column88: a violation of X's rules. Despite the violation of X’s written policy
column89: Musk insisted the documentary stay up.“It's not obvious to me that X moderates in accordance with policies at all anymore. The site's rules as published online seem to be a pretextual smokescreen to mask its owner ultimately calling the shots in whatever way he sees it
column90: ” the source familiar with X moderation added.Julie Inman Grant
column91: a former Twitter trust and safety council member who is now suing the company for for lack of transparency over CSAM
column92: is more blunt in her assessment: “You cannot just put your finger back in the dike to stem a tsunami of child sexual expose - or a flood of deepfake porn proliferating the platform
column93: ” she said.“In my experience at Twitter from 2014 to 2016
column94: it took literally years to build this expertise - and it will take much more than that to make a meaningful change to a platform that has become so toxic it is almost unrecognizable.”Do you have insight to share? Got a tip? Contact Kylie Robison at kylie.robison@fortune.com
column95: through secure messaging app Signal at 415-735-6829
column96: or via X DM.This story was originally featured on Fortune.comRelated Quotes"`['ACN']`

column6: however

column9: Amazon.com
column10: Inc. (NASDAQ:AMZN)
column11: Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL)
column12: Netflix

column16: these companies are challenged by several others in the market
column17: particularly semiconductor giant NVIDIA Corporation (NASDAQ:NVDA). NVIDIA isn't alone either
column18: and so the original list of FAANG stocks has had to accommodate the rise of new and old mega-tech companies bolstered by the emergence of AI.Regardless of what you call these companies or who joins these new exciting groups
column19: the fact remains that the tech sector has been abuzz with news of innovations
column20: rising investments
column21: and higher profitability. At the end of the day
column22: it's starting to look like tech companies really are starting to rule the world.On February 8

column1: 3 Chip Stocks Set for Silicon Success in 2024`https://finance.yahoo.com/news/3-chip-stocks-set-silicon-110000113.html`2024-01-30 11:00:00`A few decades ago
column2: the microchip industry seemed like a niche manufacturing sector. Most perceptions of microchips and semiconductors included large desktop computers and defense communications projects. Today
column3: nearly everything needs a computer to work as the world becomes increasingly interconnected. Cars
column4: watches
column5: phones and even TVs all have some level of computing powering them.For the manufacturers of computers and their components
column6: this means an endless stream of new orders and innovations to pursue. Though semiconductors rarely make popular headlines
column7: the shift in political goals across East Asia has brought them into the spotlight. Rising tensions regarding the future of Taiwan and continuously strained supply lines have renewed commitments to returning manufacturing to the U.S.Furthermore
column8: with increasing levels of development around the world
column9: over five billion people rely on computers. Thanks to this global importance and investment in semiconductors
column10: these are three 2024 chip stocks to keep an eye on.InvestorPlace - Stock Market News

column13: 000 customers
column14: from defense to commercial
column15: ADI’s position in the market provides its stock stability.By offering a diverse lineup of products and continuously expanding through acquisitions
column16: ADI has become a jack of all trades. Now
column17: with ADI’s recent investment into a new Oregon-based factory
column18: the company sits in a perfect position to expand profits. Despite being more costly
column19: the benefits of domestic production cannot be overstated when considering ADI’s defense customers.As the need for military production supply lines ramps up
column20: ADI’s new facility provides shorter lead times and greater security. It also allows Analog Devices to capitalize on federal grants intended to financially sweeten the deal. Take into consideration lagging production investments from competitors
column21: and it makes sense why this stable stock sits at “moderate buy“.Source: JHVEPhoto / Shutterstock.comAdvanced Micro Devices‘ (NASDAQ:AMD) stock soared over 145% in the past year
column22: thanks to the introduction of training AI with graphics processing units (GPUs). This increase in demand catapulted AMD’s GPU sales
column23: but the company continues to focus on its standard processors as well.By offering a spectrum of processors
column24: AMD aims to serve every computer manufacturer’s needs. From low-performance
column25: energy-efficient chips
column26: to monstrously fast
column27: high-speed processors
column28: AMD has a product for every price point. This same philosophy extends to its GPU prices
column29: with its prices consistently coming in below the competition’s.AMD’s push for a wider product portfolio also includes specializing its general processors for more dedicated tasks. Take for example the newly unveiled Radeon RX 7600 XT graphics card from AMD. Priced at only $350
column30: the 7600 XT offers an affordable entry into the world of gaming and training AI. Innovations like this and a push towards providing accessible technology
column31: make AMD a “strong buy” among 2024 chip stocks.Source: Sundry Photography / Shutterstock.comFinally

column34: its aggressive expansion in the U.S. comes as the demand for reliable electronics supply chains soars. Its new facility in Arizona and newly announced second facility in Japan generously expand production capacity.These expansions come while demand for semiconductors remains at an all-time high post-pandemic. column1: Nextracker and Archer Daniels Midland have been highlighted as Zacks Bull and Bear of the Day`https://finance.yahoo.com/news/nextracker-archer-daniels-midland-highlighted-133200848.html`2024-02-09 13:32:00`"Chicago
column2: IL – February 9
column3: 2024 – Zacks Equity Research shares Nextracker Inc NXT as the Bull of the Day and Archer Daniels Midland ADM as the Bear of the Day. In addition
column4: Zacks Equity Research provides analysis on NVIDIA Corporation NVDA
column5: CME Group Inc. CME and BlackRock
column6: Inc. BLK.Here is a synopsis of all five stocks.Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy) stockNextracker Inc specializes in solar tracking solutions for solar power plants. Nextracker’s technology helps solar panels follow the sun’s movement throughout the day
column7: optimizing their angle to maximize energy capture. By continuously adjusting the orientation of solar panels
column8: Nextracker’s system ensures that panels receive the maximum amount of sunlight
column9: increasing the overall efficiency and output of solar power plants. The company’s unique technology helps generate more electricity from solar energy
column10: making it a key player in improving the performance and sustainability of solar energy projects.Over the past couple of years
column11: the solar industry has been suffering from higher interest rates. Higher interest rates pose challenges for the solar industry due to increased financing costs. Solar projects require substantial upfront investments
column12: and when interest rates rise
column13: borrowing becomes more expensive. The elevated cost of capital can diminish the profitability of solar ventures and thus slow business in the industry to a standstill.During the California Gold Rush
column14: some of the most successful ventures were companies such as Levi Strauss (LEVI) that didn’t mine for gold but instead supplied gold miners with the supplies they needed. The gold rush example is not a one-off – throughout history
column15: parallel businesses have often benefited more dramatically than the underlying trend.The same is occurring with NXT. While most solar companies are seeing stagnant earnings
column16: NXT’s unique product energized quarterly EPS by a robust 231% year-over-year. The results are even more impressive when you consider the current backdrop. Just ask yourself
column17: “What will happen to NXT if interest rate cuts occur in 2024 like the market expects?”Gross margin is a financial metric representing the difference between a company’s revenue and the direct costs of producing goods or services
column18: expressed as a percentage of revenue. NXT’s gross margin of 41.02% over the trailing twelve months is nearly double that of its sub-industry (33.24).How is NXT able to be so efficient?· Unique product: You can charge more when you have a unique product.Also
column19: NXT’s business has fewer labor expenses when compared to normal solar companies.· Solves the efficiency problem: Though worldwide solar usage has increased dramatically in recent years
column20: efficiency remains a significant obstacle for the space. Solar companies can now use Nextracker’s technology to help solar panels stay aligned with the sun for extended periods
column21: optimizing energy production and making solar power more efficient and cost-effective.New Innovative
column22: Fast-Growing Businesses Attract Institutional Investors2023 marked the weakest IPO market since 2016. In recent years
column23: fewer IPOs have emerged stateside because private market capital raises are increasing (there is no need to go public in many cases)
column24: and the complexity and red tape involved in going public is more difficult than ever.While the lack of new issues is a net negative for investors
column25: the trend is a positive for a company like NXT. Nextracker gives deep-pocketed institutional investors a means of gaining IPO exposure. Furthermore
column26: unlike most recent IPOs
column27: NXT’s business is far from saturated and is growing like a weed.Even before rates jumped
column28: investors began to discount cuts in the future as stubborn inflation loomed. As a result
column29: the Invesco Solar ETF (TAN)

column2: we will take a look at the 15 biggest agriculture stocks in 2024. If you want to skip our overview of the agriculture industry and what can be classified as an agriculture stock
column3: then you can take a look at the 5 Biggest Agriculture Stocks in 2024. Despite having been replaced by industrialization
column4: services
column5: and now information technology
column6: agriculture is nevertheless indispensable when it comes to maintaining and growing modern day societies. At the same time
column7: since it's the one industry that has accompanied modern day civilization since its start
column8: agriculture has also evolved with the ages. Now
column9: companies that we can characterize as agriculture stocks no longer need to be involved either directly in the process of farming
column10: in the process of storing food
column11: or even in providing products such as pesticides and fertilizers to make a farmer's life easier.Instead
column12: agriculture stocks such as the industrial behemoth Deere & Company (NYSE:DE) are manufacturing firms that make complex equipment capable of carrying out the tasks of hundreds of workers at a lower cost. Machines such as the ones made by Deere have transformed the way human beings have been able to grow
column13: matching the impact by pureplay agriculture stocks such as Pacific Biosciences of California
column14: Inc. (NASDAQ:PACB) and Corteva
column15: Inc. (NYSE:CTVA).In fact
column16: technologies that agriculture stocks such as Pacific Biosciences rely on would be classified as nothing short of science fiction at the very least or even magic by farmers of previous centuries. PacBio sells systems that enable scientists and researchers to sequence the code of biological organisms. So
column17: while farmers of 1900 would have to contend with seeing their crops die in the face of disease
column18: today's farmers can rely on crops that have been genetically engineered to be resistant to the same attackers. Similarly
column19: ranchers or cattle farmers can rely on livestock capable of meeting modern day production needs of both milk and meat.All these factors combined mean that agriculture stocks are quite lucrative. column21: like their counterparts in the consumer defensive stock sector.At the same time

column4: it said.The two sources said that in recent days the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) has interviewed former ADM employees about accounting practices at the 122-year old Chicago-based maker of animal feed
