column8: down 4.6% from the year-ago quarter.Estimate Revisions TrendThe consensus EPS estimate for the quarter has been revised 2.66% lower over the last 30 days to the current level. This is essentially a reflection of how the covering analysts have collectively reassessed their initial estimates over this period.Investors should keep in mind that the direction of estimate revisions by each of the covering analysts may not always get reflected in the aggregate change.Earnings WhisperEstimate revisions ahead of a company's earnings release offer clues to the business conditions for the period whose results are coming out. This insight is at the core of our proprietary surprise prediction model -- the Zacks Earnings ESP (Expected Surprise Prediction).The Zacks Earnings ESP compares the Most Accurate Estimate to the Zacks Consensus Estimate for the quarter; the Most Accurate Estimate is a more recent version of the Zacks Consensus EPS estimate. The idea here is that analysts revising their estimates right before an earnings release have the latest information
column9: which could potentially be more accurate than what they and others contributing to the consensus had predicted earlier.Thus
column10: a positive or negative Earnings ESP reading theoretically indicates the likely deviation of the actual earnings from the consensus estimate. However
column11: the model's predictive power is significant for positive ESP readings only.A positive Earnings ESP is a strong predictor of an earnings beat
column12: particularly when combined with a Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy)
column13: 2 (Buy) or 3 (Hold). Our research shows that stocks with this combination produce a positive surprise nearly 70% of the time
column14: and a solid Zacks Rank actually increases the predictive power of Earnings ESP.Please note that a negative Earnings ESP reading is not indicative of an earnings miss. Our research shows that it is difficult to predict an earnings beat with any degree of confidence for stocks with negative Earnings ESP readings and/or Zacks Rank of 4 (Sell) or 5 (Strong Sell).How Have the Numbers Shaped Up for American International Group?For American International Group
column15: the Most Accurate Estimate is lower than the Zacks Consensus Estimate
column16: suggesting that analysts have recently become bearish on the company's earnings prospects. This has resulted in an Earnings ESP of -0.56%.On the other hand
column17: the stock currently carries a Zacks Rank of #3.So
column18: this combination makes it difficult to conclusively predict that American International Group will beat the consensus EPS estimate.Does Earnings Surprise History Hold Any Clue?While calculating estimates for a company's future earnings
column19: analysts often consider to what extent it has been able to match past consensus estimates. So
column20: it's worth taking a look at the surprise history for gauging its influence on the upcoming number.For the last reported quarter
column21: it was expected that American International Group would post earnings of $1.55 per share when it actually produced earnings of $1.61
column22: delivering a surprise of +3.87%.Over the last four quarters
column23: the company has beaten consensus EPS estimates four times.Bottom LineAn earnings beat or miss may not be the sole basis for a stock moving higher or lower. Many stocks end up losing ground despite an earnings beat due to other factors that disappoint investors. Similarly
column24: unforeseen catalysts help a number of stocks gain despite an earnings miss.That said
column25: betting on stocks that are expected to beat earnings expectations does increase the odds of success. This is why it's worth checking a company's Earnings ESP and Zacks Rank ahead of its quarterly release. Make sure to utilize our Earnings ESP Filter to uncover the best stocks to buy or sell before they've reported.American International Group doesn't appear a compelling earnings-beat candidate. column2: Inc.'s (NASDAQ:AKAM) Intrinsic Value Is Potentially 37% Above Its Share Price`https://finance.yahoo.com/news/akamai-technologies-inc-nasdaq-akam-134404145.html`2024-02-10 13:44:04`"Akamai Technologies' estimated fair value is US$176 based on 2 Stage Free Cash Flow to EquityAkamai Technologies' US$128 share price signals that it might be 27% undervalued The US$121 analyst price target for AKAM is 31% less than our estimate of fair valueIn this article we are going to estimate the intrinsic value of Akamai Technologies
column3: Inc. (NASDAQ:AKAM) by estimating the company's future cash flows and discounting them to their present value. We will take advantage of the Discounted Cash Flow (DCF) model for this purpose. Models like these may appear beyond the comprehension of a lay person
column4: but they're fairly easy to follow.We generally believe that a company's value is the present value of all of the cash it will generate in the future. However
column5: a DCF is just one valuation metric among many
column6: and it is not without flaws. For those who are keen learners of equity analysis
column7: the Simply Wall St analysis model here may be something of interest to you. Check out our latest analysis for Akamai Technologies We use what is known as a 2-stage model
column8: which simply means we have two different periods of growth rates for the company's cash flows. Generally the first stage is higher growth
column9: and the second stage is a lower growth phase. In the first stage we need to estimate the cash flows to the business over the next ten years. Where possible we use analyst estimates
column10: but when these aren't available we extrapolate the previous free cash flow (FCF) from the last estimate or reported value. We assume companies with shrinking free cash flow will slow their rate of shrinkage
column11: and that companies with growing free cash flow will see their growth rate slow
column12: over this period. We do this to reflect that growth tends to slow more in the early years than it does in later years.Generally we assume that a dollar today is more valuable than a dollar in the future
column13: and so the sum of these future cash flows is then discounted to today's value:2024202520262027202820292030203120322033 Levered FCF ($
column14: Millions) US$854.8mUS$1.04bUS$1.29bUS$1.39bUS$1.55bUS$1.68bUS$1.78bUS$1.87bUS$1.94bUS$2.01bGrowth Rate Estimate SourceAnalyst x12Analyst x7Analyst x1Analyst x1Analyst x1Est @ 7.75%Est @ 6.11%Est @ 4.97%Est @ 4.16%Est @ 3.60% Present Value ($
column15: Millions) Discounted @ 8.0% US$791US$893US$1.0kUS$1.0kUS$1.1kUS$1.1kUS$1.0kUS$1.0kUS$972US$932(""Est"" = FCF growth rate estimated by Simply Wall St)Present Value of 10-year Cash Flow (PVCF) = US$9.8bAfter calculating the present value of future cash flows in the initial 10-year period
column16: we need to calculate the Terminal Value
column17: which accounts for all future cash flows beyond the first stage. The Gordon Growth formula is used to calculate Terminal Value at a future annual growth rate equal to the 5-year average of the 10-year government bond yield of 2.3%. We discount the terminal cash flows to today's value at a cost of equity of 8.0%.Terminal Value (TV)= FCF2033 × (1 + g) ÷ (r – g) = US$2.0b× (1 + 2.3%) ÷ (8.0%– 2.3%) = US$36bPresent Value of Terminal Value (PVTV)= TV / (1 + r)10= US$36b÷ ( 1 + 8.0%)10= US$17bThe total value is the sum of cash flows for the next ten years plus the discounted terminal value
column18: which results in the Total Equity Value
column19: which in this case is US$26b. To get the intrinsic value per share
column20: we divide this by the total number of shares outstanding. Relative to the current share price of US$128
column21: the company appears a touch undervalued at a 27% discount to where the stock price trades currently. Remember though
column22: that this is just an approximate valuation
column23: and like any complex formula - garbage in
column24: garbage out.Now the most important inputs to a discounted cash flow are the discount rate
column25: and of course
column26: the actual cash flows. If you don't agree with these result
column27: have a go at the calculation yourself and play with the assumptions. The DCF also does not consider the possible cyclicality of an industry
column28: or a company's future capital requirements
column29: so it does not give a full picture of a company's potential performance. Given that we are looking at Akamai Technologies as potential shareholders
column30: the cost of equity is used as the discount rate
column31: rather than the cost of capital (or weighted average cost of capital
column32: WACC) which accounts for debt. In this calculation we've used 8.0%
column33: which is based on a levered beta of 1.242. Beta is a measure of a stock's volatility
column34: compared to the market as a whole. We get our beta from the industry average beta of globally comparable companies
column35: with an imposed limit between 0.8 and 2.0
column36: which is a reasonable range for a stable business.StrengthDebt is well covered by earnings and cashflows.WeaknessEarnings declined over the past year.OpportunityAnnual earnings are forecast to grow faster than the American market.Good value based on P/E ratio and estimated fair value.ThreatAnnual revenue is forecast to grow slower than the American market.Although the valuation of a company is important
column37: it ideally won't be the sole piece of analysis you scrutinize for a company. It's not possible to obtain a foolproof valuation with a DCF model. Preferably you'd apply different cases and assumptions and see how they would impact the company's valuation. If a company grows at a different rate
column38: or if its cost of equity or risk free rate changes sharply
column39: the output can look very different. Why is the intrinsic value higher than the current share price? For Akamai Technologies
column40: we've put together three additional aspects you should further examine:Risks: Every company has them
column41: and we've spotted   1 warning sign for Akamai Technologies   you should know about.Future Earnings: How does AKAM's growth rate compare to its peers and the wider market? Dig deeper into the analyst consensus number for the upcoming years by interacting with our free analyst growth expectation chart.Other Solid Businesses: Low debt
column42: high returns on equity and good past performance are fundamental to a strong business. This is essentially a reflection of how the covering analysts have collectively reassessed their initial estimates over this period.Investors should keep in mind that an aggregate change may not always reflect the direction of estimate revisions by each of the covering analysts.Earnings WhisperEstimate revisions ahead of a company's earnings release offer clues to the business conditions for the period whose results are coming out. Our proprietary surprise prediction model -- the Zacks Earnings ESP (Expected Surprise Prediction) -- has this insight at its core.The Zacks Earnings ESP compares the Most Accurate Estimate to the Zacks Consensus Estimate for the quarter; the Most Accurate Estimate is a more recent version of the Zacks Consensus EPS estimate. The idea here is that analysts revising their estimates right before an earnings release have the latest information
column9: which could potentially be more accurate than what they and others contributing to the consensus had predicted earlier.Thus

column1: Akamai Announces Content Protector to Stop Scraping Attacks`https://finance.yahoo.com/news/akamai-announces-content-protector-stop-113100183.html`2024-02-06 11:31:00`"The first scraper-specific product tailored to the unique characteristics of scraping attacks.CAMBRIDGE
column2: Mass.
column3: Feb. 6
column4: 2024 /PRNewswire/ -- Akamai Technologies
column5: Inc. (NASDAQ: AKAM)
column6: the cloud company that powers and protects life online
column7: today announced the availability of Content Protector
column8: a product that stops scraping attacks without blocking the good traffic that companies need to enhance their business.Scraper bots are a critical and often productive part of the commerce ecosystem. These bots search for new content
column9: highlight products in comparison sites
column10: and gather updated product information to share with customers. Unfortunately
column11: scrapers also get used for harmful purposes such as competitive undercutting
column12: surveillance before inventory hoarding attacks
column13: and counterfeiting goods and websites. Scrapers also ping sites 24/7 unless stopped — so they can degrade site performance
column14: which in turn frustrates consumers and causes them to abandon their visits. In addition
column15: scrapers have become much more evasive and sophisticated over the past few years.Akamai Content Protector helps detect and mitigate evasive scrapers that steal content for malicious purposes. It enables improved site performance
column16: an enhanced user experience and protection of intellectual property while facilitating significantly better detections and fewer false negatives without increasing the rate of false positives. The product is designed for companies that need to protect their reputation and revenue potential. It offers tailored detections that include:Protocol-level assessment: Protocol fingerprinting checks how visitors connect to your site to ensure they're legitimate. It evaluates how the client establishes the connection with the server at the different layers of the Open Systems Interconnection (OSI) model — verifying that the parameters negotiated align with the one expected from the most common web browsers and mobile applications.Application-level assessment: Evaluates if the client can run some business logic written in JavaScript. When the client runs JavaScript
column17: it collects the device and browser characteristics and user preferences. These various data points are compared and cross-checked against the protocol-level data to verify consistency.User interaction: Analyzes user interactions to distinguish between human and bot traffic. It assesses how users interact with devices such as touch screens
column18: keyboards
column19: and mouse
column20: identifying bots through their lack of interaction or abnormal usage patterns.User behavior: Monitors visitor behavior on your website to identify unusual patterns indicative of bots.Risk classification: Provides a deterministic and actionable low-
column21: medium-
column22: or high-risk classification of the traffic
column23: based on the anomalies found during the evaluation.""Content Protector is more than just a security tool; it's a business enabler
column24: says Rupesh Chokshi
column25: SVP and GM
column26: Application Security at Akamai. ""By safeguarding your digital assets from scraping threats
column27: it prevents competitors from undercutting your offers
column28: enhances site performance to keep customers engaged
column29: and protects your brand from counterfeiters. Content Protector provides direct business value to grow your digital business with confidence.""About AkamaiAkamai powers and protects life online. Leading companies worldwide choose Akamai to build
column30: deliver
column31: and secure their digital experiences — helping billions of people live
column32: work
column33: and play every day. Akamai Connected Cloud
column34: a massively distributed edge and cloud platform
column35: puts apps and experiences closer to users and keeps threats farther away. Learn more about Akamai's cloud computing
column36: security
column37: and content delivery solutions at akamai.com and akamai.com/blog
column38: or follow Akamai Technologies on X
column39: formerly Twitter
column40: and LinkedIn.ContactJim LubinskasAkamai Media Relations703.907.9103jlubinsk@akamai.comView original content to download multimedia:https://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/akamai-announces-content-protector-to-stop-scraping-attacks-302054197.htmlSOURCE Akamai Technologies

column1: How to Find Strong Computer and Technology Stocks Slated for Positive Earnings Surprises`https://finance.yahoo.com/news/strong-computer-technology-stocks-slated-140005956.html`2024-02-05 14:00:05`Earnings are arguably the most important single number on a company's quarterly financial report. column5: important. Therefore
column6: investors should consider paying close attention to these earnings surprises
column7: as a big beat can help a stock climb even higher.2 Stocks to Add to Your WatchlistThe Zacks Earnings ESP is more formally known as the Expected Surprise Prediction
column8: and it aims to grab the inside track on the latest analyst estimate revisions ahead of a company's report. The idea is relatively intuitive as a newer projection might be based on more complete information. The ESP is calculated by comparing the Most Accurate Estimate to the Zacks Consensus Estimate

column10: now that we have a grasp on the ESP and how powerful of a tool it can be

column1: The 36% return this week takes Akso Health Group's (NASDAQ:AHG) shareholders one-year gains to 271%`https://finance.yahoo.com/news/36-return-week-takes-akso-105704044.html`2024-01-31 10:57:04`Unfortunately
column2: investing is risky - companies can and do go bankrupt. But if you pick the right business to buy shares in
column3: you can make more than you can lose. For example
column4: the Akso Health Group (NASDAQ:AHG) share price has soared 271% in the last 1 year. Most would be very happy with that
column5: especially in just one year! In more good news
column6: the share price has risen 111% in thirty days. On the other hand
column7: longer term shareholders have had a tougher run
column8: with the stock falling 32% in three years.On the back of a solid 7-day performance
column9: let's check what role the company's fundamentals have played in driving long term shareholder returns. Check out our latest analysis for Akso Health Group Because Akso Health Group made a loss in the last twelve months
column10: we think the market is probably more focussed on revenue and revenue growth
column11: at least for now. Shareholders of unprofitable companies usually expect strong revenue growth. That's because fast revenue growth can be easily extrapolated to forecast profits
column12: often of considerable size.Akso Health Group actually shrunk its revenue over the last year
column13: with a reduction of 87%. So we would not have expected the share price to rise 271%. This is a good example of how buyers can push up prices even before the fundamental metrics show much growth. It's quite likely the revenue fall was already priced in
column14: anyway.The company's revenue and earnings (over time) are depicted in the image below (click to see the exact numbers).You can see how its balance sheet has strengthened (or weakened) over time in this free interactive graphic.We're pleased to report that Akso Health Group shareholders have received a total shareholder return of 271% over one year. There's no doubt those recent returns are much better than the TSR loss of 13% per year over five years. This makes us a little wary
column15: but the business might have turned around its fortunes. While it is well worth considering the different impacts that market conditions can have on the share price
column16: there are other factors that are even more important. Even so
column17: be aware that  Akso Health Group is showing  4 warning signs in our investment analysis

column1: 3 Under-the-Radar Chip Stocks Worth Buying in 2024`https://finance.yahoo.com/news/3-under-radar-chip-stocks-155446493.html`2024-02-01 15:54:46`As the engine of artificial intelligence (AI) models and applications
column2: stocks of microchip and semiconductor companies remain red hot. The iShares Semiconductor ETF (NASDAQ:SOXX) has risen 45% in the last 12 months
column3: including a 6% increase this year.Many of the better known chip stocks
column4: such as Advanced Micro Devices (NASDAQ:AMD)
column5: have seen their share price more than double over the past year. And the gains look likely to continue as global demand for the microchips needed to power AI continues to swell and earnings move steadily upwards. According to Allied Market Research
column6: the global AI chip market was valued at $14.9 billion in 2022
column7: and is projected to reach $383.7 billion by 2032
column8: growing at a compound annual growth rate (CAGR) of 38.2%.That’s strong growth and it should continue to underpin the rise of chip stocks over the near term. Here are three under-the-radar chip stocks worth buying in 2024.InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column9: Stock Advice & Trading TipsSource: Ralf Liebhold / ShutterstockASML (NASDAQ:ASML) is a European company that doesn’t get the attention it deserves considering that it is one of the most important semiconductor-equipment makers in the world. Its stock has largely trailed the gains seen in other chipmakers
column10: having risen only 33% in the last 12 months.However
column11: that underperformance now looks to be changing with ASML stock having gained 22% so far in 2024. A strong earnings print delivered recently and growing demand for its AI microchips is fueling the stock’s rally.Due to surging demand for its microchips that power AI models
column12: ASML posted fourth quarter results that crushed analyst expectations
column13: including revenue of €7.2 billion ($7.82 billion U.S.) versus €6.90 billion that was expected. The company’s Q4 profit totaled €2.05 billion vs €1.86 billion that was expected. ASML’s revenue for all of last year rose 30% from 2022. ASML has an advantage in that it makes a machine called an “extreme ultraviolet lithography” that is required to make the world’s most advanced chips.Source: michelmond / Shutterstock.comWhile better known than ASML
column14: Applied Materials (NASDAQ:AMAT) still flies under the radar compared to other microchip and semiconductor companies. Applied Materials
column15: which supplies the materials and equipment needed to make microchips and semiconductors
column16: has seen its stock rise 47% in the last 12 months. While that’s a strong return
column17: it pales in comparison to the double and triple share price returns seen in other chip stocks over the same time period.Demand for Applied Materials’s products has never been stronger and that has helped the company’s earnings. In November of last year
column18: Applied Materials reported earnings per share (EPS) of $2.12
column19: which was well ahead of the $1.99 expected on Wall Street. Revenue came in at $6.70 billion
column20: which was also above analysts’ expectations of $6.50 billion. The company is next due to report earnings on Feb. 15 and has forecast revenue with a midpoint of $6.50 billion.Source: Katherine Welles / Shutterstock.comFor a beaten down chip stock that looks undervalued
column21: consider Texas Instruments (NASDAQ:TXN). The legacy chipmaker’s share price is down 10% over the last 12 months
column22: including a 5% pullback year to date. Trading at 22 times future earnings estimates
column23: TXN stock looks cheap compared to most other microchip and semiconductor securities. Texas Instruments also pays a dividend of $1.30 per share
column24: giving the stock a yield of 3.24%. Any dividend from a chip stock is pretty rare.TXN stock has been knocked lower in recent weeks after it issued forward guidance that missed Wall Street targets. The company cited softness in the automotive and industrial sectors as the reason for the soft guidance. Texas Instruments makes microchips that go into products in nearly every sector of the American economy
column25: from motor vehicles to consumer electronics. In time
column26: the company and its stock should bounce back. Meanwhile
column27: there’s that dividend payment.On the date of publication

column1: Here's Why We're Wary Of Buying Amgen's (NASDAQ:AMGN) For Its Upcoming Dividend`https://finance.yahoo.com/news/heres-why-were-wary-buying-125538570.html`2024-02-10 12:55:38`Amgen Inc. (NASDAQ:AMGN) is about to trade ex-dividend in the next 4 days. Typically
column2: the ex-dividend date is one business day before the record date which is the date on which a company determines the shareholders eligible to receive a dividend. The ex-dividend date is important because any transaction on a stock needs to have been settled before the record date in order to be eligible for a dividend. Accordingly
column3: Amgen investors that purchase the stock on or after the 15th of February will not receive the dividend
column4: which will be paid on the 7th of March.The company's next dividend payment will be US$2.25 per share
column5: on the back of last year when the company paid a total of US$9.00 to shareholders. Looking at the last 12 months of distributions
column6: Amgen has a trailing yield of approximately 3.1% on its current stock price of US$291.12. We love seeing companies pay a dividend
column7: but it's also important to be sure that laying the golden eggs isn't going to kill our golden goose! As a result
column8: readers should always check whether Amgen has been able to grow its dividends
column9: or if the dividend might be cut. Check out our latest analysis for Amgen Dividends are usually paid out of company profits
column10: so if a company pays out more than it earned then its dividend is usually at greater risk of being cut. Amgen paid out 68% of its earnings to investors last year
column11: a normal payout level for most businesses. A useful secondary check can be to evaluate whether Amgen generated enough free cash flow to afford its dividend. Over the last year it paid out 63% of its free cash flow as dividends
column12: within the usual range for most companies.It's encouraging to see that the dividend is covered by both profit and cash flow. This generally suggests the dividend is sustainable
column13: as long as earnings don't drop precipitously.Click here to see the company's payout ratio
column14: plus analyst estimates of its future dividends.Stocks with flat earnings can still be attractive dividend payers
column15: but it is important to be more conservative with your approach and demand a greater margin for safety when it comes to dividend sustainability. If business enters a downturn and the dividend is cut
column16: the company could see its value fall precipitously. It's not encouraging to see that Amgen's earnings are effectively flat over the past five years. We'd take that over an earnings decline any day
column17: but in the long run
column18: the best dividend stocks all grow their earnings per share.Many investors will assess a company's dividend performance by evaluating how much the dividend payments have changed over time. Since the start of our data
column19: 10 years ago
column20: Amgen has lifted its dividend by approximately 17% a year on average.Is Amgen an attractive dividend stock
column21: or better left on the shelf? Amgen has been unable to generate earnings growth
column22: but at least its dividend looks sustainable
column23: with its profit and cashflow payout ratios within reasonable limits. It's not an attractive combination from a dividend perspective
column24: and we're inclined to pass on this one for the time being.Having said that
column25: if you're looking at this stock without much concern for the dividend
column26: you should still be familiar of the risks involved with Amgen. For instance
column27: we've identified 2 warning signs for Amgen (1 can't be ignored) you should be aware of.If you're in the market for strong dividend payers
column28: we recommend checking our selection of top dividend stocks.Have feedback on this article? Concerned about the content? Get in touch with us directly. Alternatively
column29: email editorial-team (at) simplywallst.com.This article by Simply Wall St is general in nature. We provide commentary based on historical data and analyst forecasts only using an unbiased methodology and our articles are not intended to be financial advice. It does not constitute a recommendation to buy or sell any stock

column1: PBYI vs. AMGN: Which Stock Should Value Investors Buy Now?`https://finance.yahoo.com/news/pbyi-vs-amgn-stock-value-164009076.html`2024-02-09 16:40:09`Investors with an interest in Medical - Biomedical and Genetics stocks have likely encountered both Puma Biotech (PBYI) and Amgen (AMGN). But which of these two stocks offers value investors a better bang for their buck right now? We'll need to take a closer look.There are plenty of strategies for discovering value stocks

column6: so investors should rest assured that PBYI has an improving earnings outlook. However
column7: value investors will care about much more than just this.Value investors are also interested in a number of tried-and-true valuation metrics that help show when a company is undervalued at its current share price levels.The Style Score Value grade factors in a variety of key fundamental metrics
column8: including the popular P/E ratio
column9: P/S ratio
column10: earnings yield
column11: cash flow per share
column12: and a number of other key stats that are commonly used by value investors.PBYI currently has a forward P/E ratio of 7.89
column13: while AMGN has a forward P/E of 15.12. We also note that PBYI has a PEG ratio of 1.29. This figure is similar to the commonly-used P/E ratio
column14: with the PEG ratio also factoring in a company's expected earnings growth rate. AMGN currently has a PEG ratio of 2.78.Another notable valuation metric for PBYI is its P/B ratio of 6.64. Investors use the P/B ratio to look at a stock's market value versus its book value
column15: which is defined as total assets minus total liabilities. By comparison
column16: AMGN has a P/B of 25.32.These metrics
column17: and several others
column18: help PBYI earn a Value grade of A
column19: while AMGN has been given a Value grade of C.PBYI stands above AMGN thanks to its solid earnings outlook

column12: prioritizing the average EPS without NRI growth rate from the past 10
column14: or 3 years in that order

It is important to ensure that the terminal growth rate remains lower than the discount rate to facilitate convergence in the calculation.Growth Stage=EPS without NRI*[ (1 + g1) / (1 + d)*(1 + g1) ^ 2 / (1 + d) ^ 2+...+(1 + g1) ^ 10 / (1 + d) ^ 10 ]=173.32Terminal Stage=EPS without NRI*(1 + g1) ^ 10 / (1 + d) ^ 10*[ (1 + g2) / (1 + d)+(1 + g2) ^ 2 / (1 + d) ^ 2+...+(1 + g2) ^ 10 / (1 + d) ^ 10 ]=118.3Intrinsic Value: DCF (Earnings Based)=Growth Stage+Terminal Stage=291.62GuruFocus also provides the calculation using the traditional approach of free cash flow. column1: Disbarment likely awaits Ameriprise advisor accused of storming Capitol on Jan. 6`https://finance.yahoo.com/news/disbarment-likely-awaits-ameriprise-advisor-213017998.html`2024-02-02 21:30:17`"Industry disbarment most likely lies in the future for a recently suspended Ameriprise advisor who was arrested this week on charges related to the Jan. 6
column3: riot at the U.S. Capitol.Lee A. Giobbie
column4: who has been at Ameriprise since 2017
column5: was taken into custody on Tuesday over felony allegations related to civil disorder and obstruction of an official proceeding and misdemeanors concerning disorderly conduct at the Capitol building and similar charges. According to an FBI statement of facts
column6: Giobbie was among the first rioters to enter the Capitol just over three years ago in protest of the 2020 election results
column7: which many believed had been illegally tipped in favor of current President Joe Biden.The statement cites video recordings made the day of the riots showing Giobbie calling on a crowd of protestors gathered in Washington
column8: D.C.
column9: to push past bicycle racks set up as a barrier. After that line had been broken
column10: he repeatedly yelled ""the gates have been breached"" and ""we're going in.""Giobbie fought his way to the steps leading to a Capitol entrance and then was seen urging the crowd to ""push
column11: push
column12: push
column13: push"" against the line of police officers who had fallen back as a last-ditch defense. Once inside
column14: he quickly walked through the Senate rotunda
column15: was briefly detained by an officer in a stairwell and then exited the building.A spokesperson for Ameriprise said
column16: ""Upon learning of the federal indictment
column17: we immediately suspended the advisor pending an investigation by our firm."" The lawyer representing Giobbie — Hope C. Lefeber
column18: a criminal defense attorney out of Philadelphia — did not immediately respond to a request for comment.In an interview earlier this week
column19: NBC News quoted her as saying: ""This man has not engaged in any subversive activities
column20: has not been destructive in any way
column21: has not done a damn thing since Jan. 6. Now we'll have to resolve this and see where this goes.""READ MORE:Ex-broker arrested after Capitol riot dies by suicide: authoritiesFINRA scraps max fines for various financial violationsEx-Wells employee already barred as a broker gets SEC boot from advisory industryBroker expungement? Costs and difficulty set to rise this fallJoe Wojciechowski
column22: an investment fraud lawyer at Chicago-based Stoltman Law
column23: said Giobbie's arrest sets the stage for a Financial Industry Regulatory Authority investigation that could eventually lead to permanent disbarment. He noted that most of the defendants arrested in connection with the Jan. 6
column25: riots have pleaded guilty rather than fighting the charges in court.But even if Giobbie pleads to lesser crimes than the ones he's accused of
column26: FINRA is unlikely to allow him to keep his industry credentials and licensing.""It would be a layup type of case
column27: Wojciechowski said. ""It would absolutely be within their disciplinary rights to revoke his registration on a permanent basis.""According to a statement released by the U.S. Attorney's office for the District of Columbia for the third anniversary of the riots
column28: 718 of the 1
column29: 265 people so far charged with crimes related to the riots have gone on to plead guilty. Only 139 have been guilty at contested trials.Of those who were sentenced
column30: 467 were given periods of incarceration and 154 were put on home detention. The most common charge — made against 1
column31: 186 defendants — related to ""entering or remaining in a restricted federal building or ground.""Giobbie's BrokerCheck page is free of disciplinary disclosures
column32: including of his recent arrest. A FINRA spokesperson declined to comment on the case.Lou Straney
column33: a regulatory expert at Arbitration Insight
column34: said it usually takes about 30 days for a criminal complaint disclosure to show up on BrokerCheck after formal proceedings have begun. Straney noted that many advisors who are subject to FINRA investigation simply refuse to go along with the proceedings.""And if he doesn't show up
column35: he's barred for sure
column36: Straney said.The FBI's complaint states law enforcement officials learned of Giobbie's participation in the Jan. 6 riots from a confidential informant who saw internet videos of him both outside and inside the Capitol. The informant was able to identify Giobbie because of a Philadelphia Eagles hat was wearing. Giobbie's Facebook page featured at least one photo in which he was wearing the same hat.The videos
column37: according to the bureau's statement of facts
column38: show Giobbie standing early in the day on the east side of the Capitol near a line of bike racks that police had set up as a barricade. Holding a bull horn up to his cellphone
column39: he amplified a broadcast of a speech then being delivered by former President Donald Trump at a park south of the White House known as the Ellipse.Giobbie
column40: according to the complaint
column41: echoed the president when he said ""stop the steal"" — a popular rallying cry for people who question the 2020 election. When Trump said
column42: ""Does anyone believe Biden got 80 million votes?
column43: Giobbie yelled
column44: ""No!""According to Giobbie's BrokerCheck record
column45: he has been in the industry for 17 years. Before Ameriprise
column46: he was at Citigroup Global Markets from 2007 to 2009 and then Janney Montgomery Scott until 2017.Wojciechowski noted that even if Giobbie lost his brokerage licenses
column47: he would not necessarily be barred from acting as an investment advisor. Many brokers have seen their FINRA certifications pulled and continued working with clients by maintaining registration at the state level.""And then sometimes you don't have any supervision
column48: or any regulator who really pays attention to you
column49: Wojciechowski said. ""It's a big problem.""Related Quotes"`['AMP']`

column1: Insiders At Ameriprise Financial Sold US$28m In Stock
column2: Alluding To Potential Weakness`https://finance.yahoo.com/news/insiders-ameriprise-financial-sold-us-110012828.html`2024-02-01 11:00:12`Over the past year
column3: many Ameriprise Financial
column4: Inc. (NYSE:AMP) insiders sold a significant stake in the company which may have piqued investors' interest. When evaluating insider transactions
column5: knowing whether insiders are buying versus if they selling is usually more beneficial
column6: as the latter can be open to many interpretations. However
column7: when multiple insiders sell stock over a specific duration
column8: shareholders should take notice as that could possibly be a red flag.Although we don't think shareholders should simply follow insider transactions
column9: we would consider it foolish to ignore insider transactions altogether. See our latest analysis for Ameriprise Financial In the last twelve months
column10: the biggest single sale by an insider was when the Chairman & CEO
column11: James Cracchiolo
column12: sold US$14m worth of shares at a price of US$353 per share. So it's clear an insider wanted to take some cash off the table
column13: even below the current price of US$387. When an insider sells below the current price
column14: it suggests that they considered that lower price to be fair. That makes us wonder what they think of the (higher) recent valuation. However
column15: while insider selling is sometimes discouraging
column16: it's only a weak signal. This single sale was just 20% of James Cracchiolo's stake.Ameriprise Financial insiders didn't buy any shares over the last year. You can see a visual depiction of insider transactions (by companies and individuals) over the last 12 months
column17: below. If you want to know exactly who sold
column18: for how much
column19: and when
column20: simply click on the graph below!For those who like to find winning investments this free list of growing companies with recent insider purchasing
column21: could be just the ticket.Over the last three months
column22: we've seen significant insider selling at Ameriprise Financial. In total
column23: President of Advice & Wealth Management - Products and Service Delivery Joseph Sweeney dumped US$1.1m worth of shares in that time
column24: and we didn't record any purchases whatsoever. This may suggest that some insiders think that the shares are not cheap.I like to look at how many shares insiders own in a company
column25: to help inform my view of how aligned they are with insiders. I reckon it's a good sign if insiders own a significant number of shares in the company. Ameriprise Financial insiders own about US$104m worth of shares (which is 0.3% of the company). This kind of significant ownership by insiders does generally increase the chance that the company is run in the interest of all shareholders.An insider hasn't bought Ameriprise Financial stock in the last three months
column26: but there was some selling. And even if we look at the last year
column27: we didn't see any purchases. While insiders do own a lot of shares in the company (which is good)
column28: our analysis of their transactions doesn't make us feel confident about the company. While we like knowing what's going on with the insider's ownership and transactions
column29: we make sure to also consider what risks are facing a stock before making any investment decision. Case in point: We've spotted 2 warning signs for Ameriprise Financial you should be aware of.Of course Ameriprise Financial may not be the best stock to buy. Top 12 Stocks To Buy In 10 Different Sectors for the Next 3 Months`https://finance.yahoo.com/news/top-12-stocks-buy-10-152540880.html`2024-02-10 15:25:40`In this piece
column2: we will take a look at the top 12 stocks to buy in 10 different sectors for the next 3 months. If you want to skip our introduction to how spreading a portfolio across several sectors might help long term performance according to financial literature
column3: then you can take a look at the Top 5 Stocks To Buy In 10 Different Sectors for the Next 3 Months.The spread of technology and the broad use of the Internet by people belonging to all walks of life has significantly increased the exposure that people have to information. This is true for politics
column4: sports
column5: and finance - as both those who work in these industries and others whose well being is tied to their performance are able to stay abreast with the latest developments. Social media stocks such as Meta Platforms
column6: Inc. (NASDAQ:META)
column7: and private companies like Elon Musk's well known X (formerly called Twitter) enable a connected world and a much well informed global populace.For instance
column8: if you're interested to learn from those who spend the better part of their day dabbling in all things finance
column9: then you can always consult Twitter. Diverse viewpoints are important when it comes to risking money on stocks
column10: and another common way of hedging an investment portfolio's risk is through diversification as well. In finance theory
column11: diversification reduces the variance that a broader portfolio's returns might face. In other words
column12: it reduces the wild downswings that might significantly reduce principal value in case of an untoward event in one industry
column13: providing investors with peace of mind and better chances of optimal cardiovascular performance.Additionally
column14: the sheer plethora of information available to investors through the Internet and traditional media also allows them to rapidly tailor and trim their investments in response to news. For instance
column15: it takes mere seconds for all major stock indexes such as the NASDAQ
column16: the S&P 500
column17: and the NYSE to fall when the Federal Reserve surprises investors by beefing up interest rates
column18: or rise when macroeconomic and political stability is assured. When it comes to investing in stocks that belong to different sectors

column1: Top 12 Stocks To Buy In 10 Different Sectors for the Next 3 Months`https://finance.yahoo.com/news/top-12-stocks-buy-10-152540880.html`2024-02-10 15:25:40`In this piece

column10: and another common way of hedging an investment portfolio's risk is through diversification as well. In finance theory

Do Its Financials Have Any Role To Play In Driving Amazon.com
column2: Inc.'s (NASDAQ:AMZN) Stock Up Recently?`https://finance.yahoo.com/news/financials-role-play-driving-amazon-120024420.html`2024-02-10 12:00:24`"Amazon.com (NASDAQ:AMZN) has had a great run on the share market with its stock up by a significant 22% over the last three months. We wonder if and what role the company's financials play in that price change as a company's long-term fundamentals usually dictate market outcomes. In this article
column3: we decided to focus on Amazon.com's  ROE.Return on equity or ROE is an important factor to be considered by a shareholder because it tells them how effectively their capital is being reinvested. Put another way
column4: it reveals the company's success at turning shareholder investments into profits. See our latest analysis for Amazon.com The formula for ROE is:Return on Equity = Net Profit (from continuing operations) ÷ Shareholders' EquitySo
column5: based on the above formula
column6: the ROE for Amazon.com is:15% = US$30b ÷ US$202b (Based on the trailing twelve months to December 2023).The 'return' is the income the business earned over the last year. Another way to think of that is that for every $1 worth of equity
column7: the company was able to earn $0.15 in profit.We have already established that ROE serves as an efficient profit-generating gauge for a company's future earnings. Depending on how much of these profits the company reinvests or ""retains""
column8: and how effectively it does so
column9: we are then able to assess a company’s earnings growth potential. Assuming everything else remains unchanged
column10: the higher the ROE and profit retention
column11: the higher the growth rate of a company compared to companies that don't necessarily bear these characteristics.To begin with
column12: Amazon.com seems to have a respectable ROE. Yet
column13: the fact that the company's ROE is lower than the industry average of 19% does temper our expectations. However
column14: the moderate 5.7% net income growth seen by Amazon.com over the past five years is definitely a positive. So
column15: there might be other aspects that are positively influencing earnings growth. Such as - high earnings retention or an efficient management in place. However
column16: not to forget
column17: the company does have a decent ROE to begin with
column18: just that it is lower than the industry average. So this also does lend some color to the fairly high earnings growth seen by the company.As a next step
column19: we compared Amazon.com's net income growth with the industry and were disappointed to see that the company's growth is lower than the industry average growth of 13% in the same period.Earnings growth is a huge factor in stock valuation. It’s important for an investor to know whether the market has priced in the company's expected earnings growth (or decline). This then helps them determine if the stock is placed for a bright or bleak future. What is AMZN worth today? The  intrinsic value infographic in our free research report  helps visualize whether AMZN is currently mispriced by the market.Amazon.com doesn't pay any dividend
column20: meaning that all of its profits are being reinvested in the business
column21: which explains the fair bit of earnings growth the company has seen.Overall
column22: we feel that Amazon.com certainly does have some positive factors to consider. Specifically
column23: we like that the company is reinvesting a huge chunk of its profits at a respectable rate of return. This of course has caused the company to see a good amount of growth in its earnings. With that said
column24: the latest industry analyst forecasts reveal that the company's earnings are expected to accelerate. To know more about the latest analysts predictions for the company
column25: check out this visualization of analyst forecasts for the company.Have feedback on this article? Concerned about the content? Get in touch with us directly. Alternatively
column26: email editorial-team (at) simplywallst.com.This article by Simply Wall St is general in nature. We provide commentary based on historical data and analyst forecasts only using an unbiased methodology and our articles are not intended to be financial advice. It does not constitute a recommendation to buy or sell any stock
column27: and does not take account of your objectives
column28: or your financial situation. We aim to bring you long-term focused analysis driven by fundamental data. Note that our analysis may not factor in the latest price-sensitive company announcements or qualitative material. Simply Wall St has no position in any stocks mentioned.Related Quotes"`['AMZN']`

column1: ‘Riding High’: Evercore Suggests 2 Top Franchise Auto Dealer Stocks to Buy Now`https://finance.yahoo.com/news/riding-high-evercore-suggests-2-162137720.html`2024-02-01 16:21:37`Americans have a long-lasting love affair with cars
column2: and it shows in the economy. The automotive industry accounts for approximately 3% of the nation’s GDP
column3: and car sales are a huge business. In its mid-2023 report
column4: the National Auto Dealers Association reported that 16
column5: 839 franchised dealers had sold 7.66 million light-duty vehicles (cars and light trucks) in 1H23. Total dealer sales in light-duty vehicles for the half-year came to $614 billion and that was supplemented by $73 billion worth of service and parts orders.In addition to its footprint
column6: the franchise auto dealer sector benefits from structural defenses against economic downturns. While auto dealers are generally synonymous with new car sales
column7: their business is highly diversified. They engage in used car sales
column8: finance
column9: credit
column10: insurance services
column11: parts
column12: and repairs. Typically
column13: new car sales account for only 25% to 30% of a franchise dealer’s gross profits.Keeping this background in mind
column14: in a recent sector report
column15: Evercore analyst and automotive expert Doug Dutton lays out reasons to be optimistic about the segment. “We are constructive on the entire Franchise Auto Dealer sector
column16: and both securities
column17: for different reasons
column18: ” said the analyst. “Our multi-year normalization thesis centers around Auto sales volumes (New/Used)
column19: upcoming ‘rate of change trough’ on Gross Profit per Unit
column20: and capital allocation priorities while these growing businesses continue to expand their footprints and build scale across the US.”Specifically
column21: Dutton has tagged two auto dealer stocks for investors to buy now
column22: and both have Buy ratings from the rest of the Street as well
column23: according to the TipRanks data. Let’s take a closer look.Lithia Motors (LAD)First on the list is Lithia Motors
column24: one of the largest automotive dealer groups in the US. The Oregon-based company has 290 dealerships in the US
column25: plus another 14 in Canada and 40 more in the UK. The company’s US business boasts 58
column26: 425 new cars on the lots
column27: along with 32
column28: 131 pre-owned vehicles and another 5
column29: 470 certified pre-owned cars; in Canada
column30: the company has some 1
column31: 000 cars on the lots
column32: and in the UK
column33: approximately 3
column34: 000.The company’s heavy exposure to used cars has been an advantage in recent years
column35: despite volatility in the used car markets. Prices for pre-owned vehicles
column36: while down from one-year ago
column37: remain elevated compared to pre-pandemic levels; according to industry experts
column38: prices for used cars are up by an average of 50% when compared to 2019.For customers
column39: Lithia offers a wide range of vehicle brands and nameplates. Buys can find venerable names from the Motor City – Ford
column40: Dodge
column41: Chevy – along with imports from Japan and Korea – Nissan and Kia – and even high-end luxury names like Maserati and Rolls Royce.Lithia will announce its results for 4Q23
column42: and the full year 2023
column43: this coming February 14
column44: but a look at the last results
column45: from 3Q23
column46: will give an idea where the firm currently stands. Revenue in the quarter came to $8.3 billion
column47: an increase of 13% from the $7.3 billion reported in 3Q22 – and it beat the forecast by $130 million. The company’s adj. EPS was reported as $9.25
column48: a figure that missed the forecast by 82 cents per share. Looking forward
column49: the expectations for the upcoming 4Q report include revenue at $7.95 billion and earnings at $8.27 per share.For Evercore’s Dutton
column50: the story here revolves around Lithia’s solid position in the car sales niche
column51: and its ability to continue its expansion. He writes of the company
column52: “Lithia
column53: like most dealers
column54: is levered to US SAAR (seasonally adjusted annual rate)
column55: but also has an idiosyncratic ‘kicker’ in the form of its online platform leadership and aggressive mid-decade expansion goals… The level of belief in US consumer/SAAR strength and Lithia’s ability to execute and keep the M&A pipeline flowing will shape investor sentiment on the equity… LAD’s strong dealmaking ability where dealer testimonials point to a smooth & efficient changeover process allows it to engineer strong EPS growth
column56: helping to reach goal of $50/share in ’25 and $2 of EPS per $1Bn in revenue by late-decade.”These comments support Dutton’s Outperform (Buy) rating
column57: and his $400 price target points toward a one-year upside potential of 35.5%. (To watch Dutton’s track record
column58: click here)Wall Street gives Lithia’s stock a Moderate Buy consensus rating
column59: based on 7 recent analyst reviews that include 4 Buys to 3 Holds. The shares are priced at $294.85 and their $351.14 average price target implies an upside of 19% in the next 12 months. (See Lithia’s stock forecast)AutoNation (AN)The second Evercore pick we’ll look at is AutoNation
column60: a company that – like Lithia above – is a perennial member of the ‘top 5’ in US automotive dealer networks. The company has a market cap just over $6 billion and boasts a network of some 300 dealer locations spread across 20 states. AutoNation was founded in 1996 and in 2011 became the first US dealer network to sell a total of 8 million vehicles. AutoNation has sold over 14 million vehicles since its founding.AutoNation’s business is split into four main segments: new vehicles
column61: used vehicles
column62: after-sales
column63: and customer financial services. The largest of these is new vehicles
column64: which makes up approximately 46% of the company’s total business. Used vehicles make up just under 32% of AutoNation’s work
column65: while the remainder is split between after-sales and financial services.The company’s most recent financial statement
column66: from 3Q23
column67: showed beats on both the top-and bottom-line. Revenues hit $6.9 billion. This was up 3% from the prior-year period
column68: and was $190 million over the estimates. The company reported a non-GAAP EPS of $5.54
column69: down from the $6.31 in 3Q22
column70: although it beat the forecast by 4 cents per share. AutoNation’s new vehicle revenue was up 11% in the quarter
column71: and used vehicle revenue was up 10%.AutoNation is expected to release its 4Q23 figures in the middle of the month
column72: and the forecast calls for revenues of $6.69 billion supporting an EPS of $4.94. For comparison
column73: the 4Q22 numbers came to $6.7 billion in revenue and $6.37 in adjusted EPS.Analyst Dutton likes AutoNation for its combination of various factors. He writes of the stock
column74: “AutoNation is operating as a more mature business with less inorganic growth and higher ROE/ROA
column75: while continuing to return significant capital to shareholders (AN could buyback >75% of current stock with FCF through end of decade). The stock trades at a 1pt multiple discount to LAD for this reason (~6.5x vs ~7.5x P/E)
column76: and while solid earnings should continue with 5%+ organic EPS growth
column77: we are constructive on AN for different reasons given the divergent growth profile (Rev only growing from $26Bn ’22 to $28Bn ’25 with EBIT down).”Getting down to the brass tacks
column78: Dutton gives these shares an Outperform rating
column79: and a $185 price target that implies a 12-month share appreciation of nearly 32.5%.Looking at the Street’s view of AutoNation
column80: we find that the analysts have given the stock 6 recent reviews – with a 4 to 2 breakdown favoring Buy over Hold
column81: for a Moderate Buy consensus rating. These shares are trading for $139.66
column82: and their $181.50 average price target suggests an upside of 30% on the one-year horizon. (See AutoNation stock forecast)To find good ideas for stocks trading at attractive valuations

The content is intended to be used for informational purposes only. It is very important to do your own analysis before making any investment.Related Quotes`['AN'

column1: AutoNation Stock (NYSE:AN): Bearish Options Traders are Ignoring This Catalyst`https://finance.yahoo.com/news/autonation-stock-nyse-bearish-options-210344132.html`2024-01-22 21:03:44`With American households still facing a daunting environment of elevated inflation and high borrowing costs
column2: targeting automotive retailer AutoNation (NYSE:AN) might not seem to be a particularly bright idea. Unsurprisingly
column3: bearish traders in both the open and options market imply that long-side speculators could get smoked. However
column4: the company may drive higher on an underappreciated catalyst. Combined with the potential for short-covering activities
column5: AN stock could fly higher
column6: making me bullish.Although demand for certain high-ticket items fell last year
column7: not every entity suffered the same magnitude of pain. Some investments
column8: such as AN stock
column9: actually saw positive returns — in this case
column10: a lift of almost 22% in the past 52 weeks. That might seem odd
column11: given the tough circumstances that consumers find themselves in. However
column12: certain factors could eventually favor the auto retailer.First
column13: many market participants expect the Federal Reserve to reduce the interest rates later this year. To be fair
column14: a hotter-than-expected December jobs report clouds this narrative. If the labor force remains robust
column15: this dynamic would translate to more dollars chasing after fewer goods. That’s not exactly a great framework for lowering borrowing costs.Still
column16: it’s impossible to know with absolute certainty what might happen in the future. Should rates decline
column17: as the Fed hinted at last month
column18: buying expensive items will likely be far less onerous. According to data from the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System
column19: the finance rate for 60-month loans for new vehicles shot up to 8.15% in November 2023.In February 2022
column20: that rate was at 4.52%. Unsurprisingly
column21: total vehicle sales began conspicuously falling since June of last year. Potentially
column22: reduced borrowing costs could reinvigorate sentiment
column23: thus lifting AN stock.Second and more importantly
column24: consumers may have little choice in the matter. In 2023
column25: the average age of vehicles on U.S. roadways hit 12.5 years
column26: a fresh record. At some point
column27: even the most reliable cars will incur mechanical issues. Financially
column28: it just might make more sense to find a replacement vehicle rather than keep repairing a money pit.If lower interest rates become the norm
column29: consumers may view purchasing a vehicle as a no-brainer
column30: benefiting AutoNation.Nevertheless
column31: the implied pessimism in the options market represents a warning shot to those considering buying AN stock. In particular
column32: TipRanks’ screener for unusual options activity shows several transactions with bearish implications. Typically
column33: these trades revolve around bought puts
column34: which give holders the right (but not the obligation) to sell the underlying security at the listed strike price.However
column35: pessimists can also take a more daring approach with sold (written) calls. In particular
column36: two bearish call option transactions – 400 contracts of the AN Feb 16 ’24 160.00 call and 410 contracts of the AN Feb 16 ’24 165.00 call – warrant close attention. Both transactions occurred on January 10.In summary
column37: these traders are betting that AN stock won’t rise materially above the $160 and $165 strike prices by the February 16 deadline. If AN fails to do so
column38: the bearish trader can potentially collect the maximum premium
column39: that is
column40: the funds received for selling the aforementioned contracts.Of course
column41: the risk centers on AN stock possibly moving higher instead of lower. For example
column42: if AutoNation drives up to $200
column43: the bearish trader is contractually obligated to fulfill the underlying terms upon exercise: sell AN shares at $160 and $165. Therefore
column44: the loss comes out as the difference between what the shares could have been sold for versus the strike price minus the premium.In addition
column45: if the written calls were uncovered
column46: the bearish trader must buy AN stock at the open market price and sell it at the lower strike price. Therefore
column47: uncovered short calls expose participating traders to uncapped loss potential
column48: adding pressure to the situation.Finally
column49: the bears are also betting against AN stock directly. Currently
column50: AutoNation’s short interest as a percentage of its float stands at 11.93%. Also
column51: the short interest ratio comes in at 13.15 days to cover. If AutoNation jumps higher for any reason
column52: a short-covering panic could erupt
column53: leading to significant upside.Notably
column54: Autonation stock’s financials are surprisingly resilient
column55: as the company has been posting profits every year. Perhaps most conspicuously
column56: even in the pandemic-disrupted year of 2020
column57: the company posted operating income of $939 million and net income of $381.6 million. Surely
column58: the business has undertones of discretionary sentiment. At the same time
column59: many people need personal transportation
column60: thus making the service a necessity.It’s also hard to ignore the discount at play. At the moment
column61: shares trade at a trailing-year earnings multiple of 6x. However
column62: the sector average for the auto and truck dealership segment comes in at 9.71x. With many elements working in favor of the bullish thesis
column63: the bears are probably feeling the heat.Turning to Wall Street
column64: AN stock has a Moderate Buy consensus rating based on four Buys
column65: two Holds
column66: and zero Sell ratings. The average AN price target is $181.83
column67: implying 26.9% upside potential.At first glance
column68: the tough challenges that American households face don’t make AutoNation an enticing bullish idea. However
column69: with cars on roadways becoming increasingly older
column70: consumers must start considering buying replacements. That’s a catalyst that bearish traders (both in the open market and the options market) could be ignoring
column71: setting up a potentially lucrative showdown for optimists. On top of that

column1: These 2 Retail-Wholesale Stocks Could Beat Earnings: Why They Should Be on Your Radar`https://finance.yahoo.com/news/2-retail-wholesale-stocks-could-140006084.html`2024-02-06 14:00:06`Wall Street watches a company's quarterly report closely to understand as much as possible about its recent performance and what to expect going forward. Of course
column2: one figure often stands out among the rest: earnings.We know earnings results are vital
column3: but how a company performs compared to bottom line expectations can be even more important when it comes to stock prices
column4: especially in the near-term. This means that investors might want to take advantage of these earnings surprises.2 Stocks to Add to Your WatchlistThe Zacks Earnings ESP
column5: or Expected Surprise Prediction
column6: aims to find earnings surprises by focusing on the most recent analyst revisions. The basic premise is that if an analyst reevaluates their earnings estimate ahead of an earnings release
column7: it means they likely have new information that could possibly be more accurate. The core of the ESP model is comparing the Most Accurate Estimate to the Zacks Consensus Estimate
column8: where the resulting percentage difference between the two equals the Expected Surprise Prediction.Now that we understand what the ESP is and how beneficial it can be
column9: let's dive into a stock that currently fits the bill. Dick's Sporting Goods (DKS) earns a Zacks Rank #3 right now and its Most Accurate Estimate sits at $3.30 a share
column10: just 28 days from its upcoming earnings release on March 5
column11: 2024.DKS has an Earnings ESP figure of 0.17%
column12: which
column13: as explained above
column14: is calculated by taking the percentage difference between the $3.30 Most Accurate Estimate and the Zacks Consensus Estimate of $3.29.DKS is part of a big group of Retail-Wholesale stocks that boast a positive ESP
column15: and investors may want to take a look at Abercrombie & Fitch (ANF) as well.Abercrombie & Fitch
column16: which is readying to report earnings on March 6
column18: sits at a Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy) right now. It's Most Accurate Estimate is currently $2.82 a share
column19: and ANF is 29 days out from its next earnings report.For Abercrombie & Fitch
column20: the percentage difference between its Most Accurate Estimate and its Zacks Consensus Estimate of $2.71 is 4.34%.DKS and ANF's positive ESP figures tell us that both stocks have a good chance at beating analyst expectations in their next earnings report.Find Stocks to Buy or Sell Before They're ReportedUse the Zacks Earnings ESP Filter to turn up stocks with the highest probability of positively
column21: or negatively
column22: surprising to buy or sell before they're reported for profitable earnings season trading. Check it out here >>Want the latest recommendations from Zacks Investment Research? Today
column23: you can download 7 Best Stocks for the Next 30 Days. Click to get this free reportDICK'S Sporting Goods

Earnings Miss: Here's What Air Products and Chemicals
column2: Inc. (NYSE:APD) Analysts Are Forecasting For This Year`https://finance.yahoo.com/news/earnings-miss-heres-air-products-111847899.html`2024-02-07 11:18:47`It's shaping up to be a tough period for Air Products and Chemicals
column3: Inc. (NYSE:APD)
column4: which a week ago released some disappointing first-quarter results that could have a notable impact on how the market views the stock. Air Products and Chemicals missed analyst forecasts
column5: with revenues of US$3.0b and statutory earnings per share (EPS) of US$2.73
column6: falling short by 6.6% and 7.6% respectively. Following the result
column7: the analysts have updated their earnings model
column8: and it would be good to know whether they think there's been a strong change in the company's prospects
column9: or if it's business as usual. Readers will be glad to know we've aggregated the latest statutory forecasts to see whether the analysts have changed their mind on Air Products and Chemicals after the latest results. Check out our latest analysis for Air Products and Chemicals After the latest results
column10: the 21 analysts covering Air Products and Chemicals are now predicting revenues of US$12.9b in 2024. If met
column11: this would reflect a reasonable 3.7% improvement in revenue compared to the last 12 months. Statutory earnings per share are predicted to expand 20% to US$12.55. In the lead-up to this report
column12: the analysts had been modelling revenues of US$13.4b and earnings per share (EPS) of US$13.01 in 2024. The analysts are less bullish than they were before these results
column13: given the reduced revenue forecasts and the small dip in earnings per share expectations.The consensus price target fell 7.5% to US$286
column14: with the weaker earnings outlook clearly leading valuation estimates. There's another way to think about price targets though
column15: and that's to look at the range of price targets put forward by analysts
column16: because a wide range of estimates could suggest a diverse view on possible outcomes for the business. The most optimistic Air Products and Chemicals analyst has a price target of US$355 per share
column17: while the most pessimistic values it at US$240. Analysts definitely have varying views on the business
column18: but the spread of estimates is not wide enough in our view to suggest that extreme outcomes could await Air Products and Chemicals shareholders.These estimates are interesting
column19: but it can be useful to paint some more broad strokes when seeing how forecasts compare
column20: both to the Air Products and Chemicals' past performance and to peers in the same industry. It's pretty clear that there is an expectation that Air Products and Chemicals' revenue growth will slow down substantially
column21: with revenues to the end of 2024 expected to display 4.9% growth on an annualised basis. This is compared to a historical growth rate of 9.7% over the past five years. Juxtapose this against the other companies in the industry with analyst coverage
column22: which are forecast to grow their revenues (in aggregate) 3.3% per year. So it's pretty clear that
column23: while Air Products and Chemicals' revenue growth is expected to slow
column24: it's still expected to grow faster than the industry itself.The most important thing to take away is that the analysts downgraded their earnings per share estimates
column25: showing that there has been a clear decline in sentiment following these results. Regrettably
column26: they also downgraded their revenue estimates
column27: but the latest forecasts still imply the business will grow faster than the wider industry. The consensus price target fell measurably
column28: with the analysts seemingly not reassured by the latest results
column29: leading to a lower estimate of Air Products and Chemicals' future valuation.With that said
column30: the long-term trajectory of the company's earnings is a lot more important than next year. At Simply Wall St
column31: we have a full range of analyst estimates for Air Products and Chemicals going out to 2026
column32: and you can see them free on our platform here..We don't want to rain on the parade too much
column33: but we did also find 2 warning signs for Air Products and Chemicals that you need to be mindful of.Have feedback on this article? Concerned about the content? Get in touch with us directly. Alternatively
column34: email editorial-team (at) simplywallst.com.This article by Simply Wall St is general in nature. We provide commentary based on historical data and analyst forecasts only using an unbiased methodology and our articles are not intended to be financial advice. It does not constitute a recommendation to buy or sell any stock
column35: and does not take account of your objectives
column36: or your financial situation. We aim to bring you long-term focused analysis driven by fundamental data. Note that our analysis may not factor in the latest price-sensitive company announcements or qualitative material. Simply Wall St has no position in any stocks mentioned.Related Quotes`['APD']`

column1: Air Products Sees $15B Hydrogen
column2: Energy Transition Project Backlog`https://finance.yahoo.com/news/air-products-sees-15b-hydrogen-085818876.html`2024-02-07 08:58:18`Industrial gases company Air Products continues to strengthen its hydrogen position with a hydrogen and energy transition backlog of about $15 billion.The Pennsylvania-headquartered company has eight hydrogen projects underway
column3: targeting an IRR of more than 10%. The projects include three blue hydrogen projects—two in Louisiana and one in the Netherlands—as well as a green hydrogen project in New York.“Air Products is pursuing a first mover growth strategy with our core industrial gases business as the first pillar and our blue and green hydrogen projects as the second pillar
column4: ” Air Products CEO Seifi Ghasemi said during the company’s Feb. 5 earnings webcast. “Executing our strategy in these two pillars
column5: with sustainability underpinning both of them
column6: enables us to fulfill our higher purpose as a company
column7: which is to help solve significant energy and environmental challenges in our world.”Used mostly today for oil refining and production of ammonia
column8: a key ingredient for fertilizers
column9: hydrogen is seen as a promising route to decarbonize hard-to-abate sectors and reduce reliance on fossil fuels. While global focus on reducing emissions has put the spotlight on hydrogen in recent years
column10: luring new players to the field
column11: Air Products has been in the hydrogen business for more than 60 years.“By producing and delivering low- and zero-carbon hydrogen at the scale for heavy duty transportation and industry
column12: we can meaningfully contribute to the goal of decarbonizing the world
column13: ” Ghasemi said. “We believe that the first mover advantage will be substantial and deliver enduring long-term shareholder value
column14: both in terms of return to Air Products and in generating a cleaner future for everybody.”Most of the company’s planned $5 billion to $5.5 billion in planned capex for the year will go toward the NEOM green hydrogen project in Saudi Arabia.Working with joint venture partners ACWA Power and NEOM Green Hydrogen Co.
column15: the $8.4 billion project will be one of the world’s largest green hydrogen projects. When complete
column16: the plant will produce up to 600 tonnes per day of hydrogen in the form of green ammonia by year-end 2026. Developers say they will use up to 4 gigawatts of solar and wind energy as part of the process.Substantial amounts will also be used for Air Products’ sustainable aviation fuel facility in Los Angeles and its blue hydrogen facility in Canada
column17: Ghasemi said. Located in Edmonton
column18: Alberta
column19: the $1.6 billion hydrogen facility will use advanced auto-thermal reforming technology. The project is currently in the construction phase
column20: Air Products COO Samir Serhan said.“We look to bring it on stream in [second-half] fiscal year ’25 in line with our customer plans
column21: ” Serhan said.He said the company had no updates regarding the project’s deployed capital or government incentives.In North Texas
column22: Air Projects is working with The AES Corp. to develop an approximately $4 billion green hydrogen production facility in Wilbarger County
column23: Texas. Air Products is in the process of getting a permit and doing preliminary engineering
column24: Ghasemi said.Also on deck for Air Products: a $4.5 billion Louisiana Clean Energy Complex
column25: where more than 750 MMscf/d of blue hydrogen will be produced and CO2 captured and permanently sequestered underground. Startup is expected in fiscal year 2027
column26: if all required permits and approvals are secured.Ghasemi said the EPA’s authorization to give the state of Louisiana approval over CO2 sequestration in the state could cut about a year off the timeline of getting a Class VI permit.Although Air Products reported 3% higher volumes driven by strong hydrogen demand and 2% higher pricing for first-quarter 2024
column27: sales in the Americas of $1.3 billion were down by 10% compared to a year earlier
column28: due to a 15% lower energy cost pass-through.Related Quotes`['APD']`

column316: we absolutely disagree with that point of view that this is limiting. I mean
column317: how is it limiting? We are complying with every single part of what the Treasury Department has put out the 3 pillars and we are committing billions of dollars to build these facilities. We believe very strongly in the 3 pillars. That means that any electricity use for production of green hydrogen needs to be additional. Otherwise
column318: you're just going to use coal to replace that power that you use. So it has to be additional.The second thing
column319: it has to be hourly. Because otherwise in the middle of the night when there is no sun
column321: then you're drawing power from the grid and that has to be replaced again from coal-fired plants and all of that. And so additionality
column322: hourly and then the other thing is that it has to be on the same network.We are fully supportive of what the Treasury Department has put out
column323: I'd like to applaud them for sticking to their principles that the IRA was designed not to make companies rich
column324: but IRA was designed to save the environment. And this should not allow people to get some subsidies if they are not doing something to reduce their pollution into the atmosphere.The IRA is not a handout. The IRA is designed
column325: that is why Congress approved it

column328: we are fully in line with the those rules that Treasury put out
